skill.description: The ability to perform acrobatic feats of dexterity such as flips, mid-air grabs, cartwheels, and similar exercises. When accompanied with a skill such as dodge, it will allow the character to perform acrobatics while dodging or other similar movement.
skill.name: Acrobatics

skill.description: [LaTeX] Advanced knowledge in one specific area of academics. This is usually in a prior area of expertise. For example, a Biologist (high level Biology skill) might have the skill.
skill.name: Advanced Academic

skill.description: The character has the knowledge of advanced communication systems, their use, limitations, abilities, satellites, industrial networking, and similar information. This also gives the character to use the tools and instruments used within the communications field.
skill.name: Advanced Communications

skill.description: Knowledge of `primitive' chemistry and related techniques. A person with this skill will know how to prepare simple chemicals (including such things as simple medicines, poisons, black powder, etc) from natural sources. This skill can also be used to prepare alchemical equivalents of magical potions at -2 LVL.
skill.name: Alchemy

skill.description: The (magical) art of divining answers to questions using a chicken.
skill.name: Alectromancy

skill.description: The knowledge of how to surprise someone or something---often by means of diversion or camouflage.
skill.name: Ambush
Anatomy

skill.description: The knowledge of history starting at 5000 years ago and extending back further. A person with this skill would know major historical events, figures, and common beliefs and myths of the various cultures existing during that time period. Higher levels represent more in-depth knowledge.
skill.name: Ancient History

skill.description: Dealing with animals. Wild or domestic.
skill.name: Animal Handling

skill.description: Knowledge of determining the value of items. Typically, the character should also have knowledge of the area.
skill.name: Appraisal

skill.description: The scientific study of cultural or natural remains, artifacts, and structures. A person with this skill would know how to excavate and preserve delicate artifacts, and how to identify them. He would also have knowledge of various past cultures, etc.
skill.name: Archaeology

skill.description: The artistic creation and basic structural design of buildings and similar structures. A person with this skill will also recognize weak points of structures, and will have a high amount of intuition as to the location of doors, hallways, etc. hidden or otherwise.
skill.name: Architecture

skill.description: The skill of winning an argument, by presenting a strong case and pointing out the flaws and errors made by the person you are arguing with. A person with this skill will be excellent at convincing others of his ideas, etc. Lawyers, politicians, philosophers, law enforcement, magistrates, etc commonly possess this skill.
skill.name: Arguing

skill.description: The knowledge of the suitability of armor, armor theory, and how to make armor. In archaic settings, this would include the skills to directly make simple armor (or complex armor in conjunction with blacksmithing). In modern settings, this includes the ability to design armor or repair it, but not the skills to make it (that would require materials science, mechanical engineering, machining, etc.) A player with this skill would know the strengths and weaknesses of the armor of his enemies.
skill.name: Armory

skill.description: Artistic skills are the production of a particular type of art. You may choose the type of art, such as painting, drawing, sculpture, calligraphy, etc.
skill.name: Art

skill.description: How to read the future in the stars; determine the course of events; auspicous days etc.
skill.name: Astrology

skill.description: The knowledge of a particular type of sport. Examples are football, tae-kwon do, soccer, and jai alai.
skill.name: Athletics

skill.description: The knowledge of various Audio/Video systems and their components, and how to assemble and operate such systems. In a modern campaign setting, this would include knowledge of such things as video sources (VCRs, DVD, etc.), displays (projectors, TVs), audio formats (CD, Record, tape), and their associated hardware, like amplifiers, speakers, etc. Professional musicians, producers for music or film, home theater enthusiasts, etc, would commonly possess this skill.
skill.name: Audio/Video
skill.occupation: intelligence, thief, cameraman, security guard, musician

skill.description: This imparts the ability to haggle over the price of goods or services, and the trading of goods and services for one another. People with this skill (salesmen, store clerks, antique dealers) will know how to get the maximum money for a product when selling it, and how to get the lowest possible price when purchasing goods.
skill.name: Bargaining/Haggling

skill.description: The physical beauty of a person, and how to accentuate it with actions, poises, as well as selection of clothing, makeup, etc.
skill.name: Beauty

skill.description: The scientific study of life. This academic skill includes the description, classification, and knowledge of function of all different life forms, including people, animals, single-cell organisms, etc.
skill.name: Biology

skill.description: The knowledge of how plants grow, and their biological processes, etc. Persons with this skill can identify plants---including those that are medicinal, poisonous, or edible.
skill.name: Botany

skill.description: Experience with dealing with the political, legal, and related processes of the time. People with this skill will know ways around [latex]`red tape'[/latex] and how to favorably deal with public services and government agencies.
skill.name: Bureaucracy
skill.occupation: diplomat, law enforcement, organized crime, politician

skill.description: The ability to determine 'good deals' and make quick business deals in order to profit from them. Persons with this skill will be good at recognizing good and bad business propositions, as well as bargains or rip-offs in the common marketplace. This skill gives the holder $50 per level per week, if he/she is in an area with people and business dealings.
skill.name: Business Sense

skill.description: The knowledge of woodworking. A person with this skill will know how to use woodworking tools, and can produce and repair things such as tools, furniture, and buildings (and building subcomponents) from wood.
skill.name: Carpentry

skill.description: Unique skill. This provides the character money. Character gets (LVL[latex]$^2$[/latex])*1000 dollars in cash, equipment, or goods. This can be bought many times.
skill.name: Cash
Chemistry

skill.description: The design of public works projects such as buildings, bridges, roadways, railroads, sewers, gas and electric services, etc.
skill.name: Civil Engineering

skill.description: The ability to climb things such as trees, buildings, walls, rock formations, ice, etc. This includes free climbing, and climbing with equipment.
skill.name: Climbing

skill.description: The knowledge of basic communication such as hand signals and gesturing, as well as modern communications methods like telephone, radio, and computerized communication---and their associated equipment.
skill.name: Communications

skill.description: The knowledge of how to write code for computers. This includes knowledge of programming languages, basic operation of the computer, and how to construct algorithms to solve problems. Computer programming implies the computer use skill. (you get computer use free with programming)
skill.name: Computer Programming

skill.description: The ability to use a computer for work and pleasure. This includes how to perform simple computer-related tasks, such as setting up a computer, basic repairs, and how to use common software---like word processing, spreadsheets, image viewing, E-mail, and Internet browsing.
skill.name: Computer Use

skill.description: The knowledge of working on a construction site. This includes preparing a site for building, reading plans---blueprints, surveying and laying a foundation, framing, and finishing a building or other structure. This also includes the use of common construction tools and heavy equipment including power tools, dump trucks, cement mixers, backhoes, and cranes. A person with this skill will also have experience with mixing concrete, laying bricks, and working with lumber and structural steel---as well as SIMPLE plumbing, electrical, and carpentry tasks.
skill.name: Construction

skill.description: The skill of preparing various dishes from scratch. A person with this skill will know many recipes, how to select and prepare ingredients, and how to cook and present a finished dish or meal. (Skill level 3 would be a professional Chef)
skill.name: Cooking

skill.description: The study of codes, including how to create, identify, and break them.
skill.name: Cryptography

skill.description: The study of cybernetics as they relate to the human body. People with this skill are knowledgeable about cybernetics, how they function, and how to design and modify or repair them. A person with this skill and the appropriate supplies can work on cyborgs.
skill.name: Cyber Medicine

skill.description: The ability to dance. Choose a particular type, such as Ballroom, Country and Western, Swing, etc.
skill.name: Dancing

skill.description: The ability to hide the truth about something, or make things appear different than they really are, by talking about them. This is NOT lying outright, etc, but cleverly presenting the evidence to further your goal. This is usually achieved by downplaying or carefully ignoring some information while strategically emphasizing other points. Bending the truth, rationalizing things, etc, falls under this skill.
skill.name: Deception
skill.occupation: Con artist, thief, crooked businessman, stage magician

skill.description: How to decorate that is pleasing to the eye.
skill.name: Decorating

skill.description: The ability to negotiate and broker deals for business, political, and legal purposes. A person with this skill will know how to make compromises that best suit his goals, and will be able to deal with people in tense situations without angering them.
skill.name: Diplomacy

skill.description: Characters with Disguise know how to make themselves look like someone else. Either to copy the looks of another person or to just change the appearance of the character. This also includes the ability to detect if someone else is in disguise.
skill.name: Disguise

skill.description: Knowledge of drinks, how to make them, etc.
skill.name: Drink Mixing

skill.description: The academic skill of the design and function of electronics and electrical systems. A person with this skill would know how to design and analyze electronic devices.
skill.name: Electrical Engineering

skill.description: The practical knowledge of the electrical wiring of homes and buildings. A person with this skill will know about the electrical wiring in buildings, and how to repair and modify such things. This includes the use of related tools, and how to identify problems and parts.
skill.name: Electrician

skill.description: The knowledge of electronic technology such as communications jamming, stealth technology, ECM, ECCM, and related topics as applied to electronics in war or combat situations.
skill.name: Electronic Warfare

skill.description: The practical skill of building, troubleshooting, and repairing electronic devices. A person with this skill would have only basic knowledge of designing electronic devices, [latext]\textit{but}[\latex] they are skilled in repairing, modifying, and working on electronic items. This includes use of electronic tools such as test equipment, soldering gear, etc.
skill.name: Electronics

skill.description: The skill of entertaining people by telling jokes, simple performances, and improvising. Being comfortable and at ease around people.
skill.name: Entertaining
Escape

skill.description: The skills required to find out information by observing others and their actions. Includes techniques for watching people and listening in on their conversations, etc, from a distance. Also, how to set up stakeouts and use technology (cameras, bugs, etc) to perform these tasks falls under the scope of this skill.
skill.name: Espionage/surveillance
skill.occupation: Military specialist, thief, detective, private investigator

skill.description: The belief in a particular religion, God(s), or a spiritual philosophy. Note that this skill is true belief in that religion, not simply knowledge about it. This skill is use for Faith-type magic. See magic section for more details
skill.name: Faith

skill.description: The character knows how to fall from a fall distance. When falling, the character can roll his skill. He can fall 10 feet per success without taking damage. Beyond that, he takes the normal 1D6 per 10 feet.
skill.name: Falling

skill.description: Knowledge growing crops, harvesting, etc. Includes knowledge of raising common farm animals and working with farm equipment.
skill.name: Farming

skill.description: Knowledge and selection of clothing and related items to maximize beauty, or to convey a particular image.
skill.name: Fashion

skill.description: The knowledge of how to make movies, commercials, and other video productions. Includes knowledge of directing, sets, working with actors, simple effects, and film editing.
skill.name: Filmography

skill.description: Basic first aid treatment for various common injuries. Includes knowledge of basic medication, bandaging, treatment of wounds, stabilizing victims, and performing very simple medical procedures in the field. A successful use of this skill will stop a person below 0 hit points from losing any more, this takes a turn to attempt.
skill.name: First Aid/Paramedicine

skill.description: Deducing the nature of a crime or other event based on evidence, especially minimal evidence. Taking and matching fingerprints, analyzing handwriting, notes, threats, study of weapons or other objects used in crimes, etc.
skill.name: Forensics

skill.description: The knowledge of how to forge signatures, documents, insignia, etc. and how to detect forged work.
skill.name: Forgery

skill.description: The knowledge of card and casino games, such as poker, blackjack, craps, baccarat, roulette, etc. This includes how to play the games, rules, the odds of winning, etc.
skill.name: Gambling

skill.description: The academic study of the earth and its geological formations---including rocks, minerals, and related scientific elements. A person with this skill would know how to identify various geological features, including gems, etc.
skill.name: Geology

skill.description: The art of glass-blowing. How to make, shape, and judge glass. How to make objects, and sculptures; things like idols, plateware, jugs, abstract art, etc. The ability to be artistic is governed by this skill. If the character also has blacksmithing, carpentry, etc. they can make their own tools, and forge. The ability to design new types of glass requires alchemy or chemistry.
skill.name: Glassblowing

skill.description: The design and layout of printed matter, such as books, magazines, newspapers, and posters and advertising materials. Includes designing such works for maximum readability and visual impact, as well as the production of printed materials. This involves typesetting, production of master copies, operating a printing press, and desktop publishing on a computer.
skill.name: Graphic Arts

skill.description: The ability to design, repair, modify, and build handguns, shotguns, and rifles. A person with this skill cannot build a gun from scratch, but can build guns from raw parts, and is skilled in the modification and tuning of firearms.
skill.name: Gunsmithing

skill.description: The art of gaining access to computer systems and software by indirect means. This often includes breaking into secured systems or networks. Password cracking, enabling protected software, etc. falls under this skill.
skill.name: Hacking/Cracking

skill.description: Historical knowledge extending from the present until 5000 years in the past. Persons with this skill will know about major political figures (and other famous people), wars, famines, natural disasters, and major cultural---scientific---religious events and discoveries made during that time.
skill.name: History

skill.description: Adds HitPoints to your character. You get two per CP spent.
skill.name: Hit Points

skill.description: Non-traditional medicine, such as acupuncture, massage therapy, use of herbal drugs, etc. Choose a branch when selecting this skill (example
skill.name: Holistic Medicine

skill.description: The ability to locate, stalk, and kill game. This includes looking for game animals and signs of their presence, tracking, and techniques for stalking them. Also, using weapons (such as bows, firearms, spears, etc.) and traps to kill game, and how to butcher game in the field for meat and skins.
skill.name: Hunting

skill.description: The skills of portraying a character or person other than oneself. Includes how to alter voice, habits and mannerisms---as well as basic costuming, etc. in order to play the part. This skill is used for professional actors, and for espionage purposes.
skill.name: Impersonation/Acting

skill.description: The ability to manipulate the emotions of others by interacting with them. Through verbal communication and body language, a person with this skill can cause others to become happy, sad, etc.
skill.name: Inspire Emotion

skill.description: Extracting information or answers to specific questions from someone through various means. This might include deceiving the target, befriending them, convincing them, intimidation/blackmail, or even torture.
skill.name: Interrogation

skill.description: The ability to guess well in situations where a person is unsure about two or more options. A person with this skill tends to guess correctly between options more than statistics would predict. This skill can only be used if the character had some knowledge in the general area of the guess to be made.
skill.name: Intuition
skill.occupation: Law enforcement, soldier, almost any other occupation

skill.name: Investigation

skill.description: Researching recent events and reporting on them concisely. This skill is common for newspapers and TV news station crews.
skill.name: Journalism

skill.description: The knowledge of a language. Possessing this skill implies proficiency of one language. Purchase this skill separately for each language a person knows. Higher levels imply greater proficiency, eloquence, and superior vocabulary. Note that if you purchase Literacy and Language together (the same language) you may purchase Language as a LVL 1 skill.
skill.name: Language

skill.description: The ability to observe situations, prioritize activities related to them, and guide people through them. All characters under the leadership of someone with this skill may add X to each of their initiative numbers. (The person with the leadership skill may do this as well) X is the number of successes on the leadership roll.
skill.name: Leadership

skill.description: Working with leather and leather goods. This includes the tanning of leather, forming it into shapes (such as bags, pouches, saddles, clothing items, weapon sheaths, etc.), and sewing it into useable goods.
skill.name: Leatherwork

skill.description: Knowledge of legal systems and how to use them.
skill.name: Legal

skill.description: The ability to write and read a written language. Note that if you purchase Literacy and Language together (the same language) you may purchase Language as a LVL 1 skill.
skill.name: Literacy

skill.description: The knowledge of well-known literature (famous works and authors), as well as general rhetoric and literary expression. Note that this is not the same thing as language, literacy, or writing.
skill.name: Literature

skill.description: The knowledge of locks, how to open them without a key, and how locks (both simple and complex) operate. This includes the use of lock-opening tools such as picks, etc.
skill.name: Lockpicking

skill.description: [LaTeX] The maximum value of the character's \emph{Luck} subattribute is increased by one.
skill.name: Luck

skill.description: Knowing how to tell a lie is a fine art, and this character knows it. The character can tell a convincing lie and to develop plausible alibis. This also allows the character to detect that someone else is lying.
skill.name: Lying
Machining

skill.description: This skill represents a magic user's ability to accurately control magic energy and make it do what she wants it to. See magic section for full information.
skill.name: Magical Control

skill.description: The academic study of magic and related processes. A character may also use this skill to identify magical items (requires touching them). It also allows a character to read magical script such as that used in spell books.
skill.name: Magical Studies

skill.description: How to add arbitrary mana points.
skill.name: Mana Points

skill.description: The ability to manage people and resources in order to accomplish a certain task. This is primarily in business personnel, as well as military commanders, etc.
skill.name: Management

skill.description: Knowledge of piloting a ship or boat. The knowledge of maritime laws, practices, and the general maintenance and operation of boats and ships fall under the scope of this skill.
skill.name: Marine Piloting

skill.description: (See Martial Arts section) This is the governing skill of the Martial Arts subsystem. It represents the level of skill that a person has in martial arts. No person may posses a martial arts technique of higher rank than his or her level of martial arts.
skill.name: Martial Arts

skill.description: The knowledge of various natural and processed substances and their uses and applications. This is a supporting skill for many engineering skills, etc.
skill.name: Materials Science

skill.description:
[LaTeX]
Knowledge of mathematical theory and techniques for apply mathematics to real life situations.
skill.name: Mathematics

skill.description: The electronics skill as applied to Mecha. This includes the design and modification of the electrical systems of mechs, including computers, sensors, and related components.
skill.name: Mecha Electronics

skill.description: The ability to operate a Mech. This skill is required in order for a character to operate a Mech. While piloting a mech, any DEX-based skill you want to use cannot have a higher level than this skill. See Mecha rules for more information.
skill.name: Mecha Piloting

skill.description: The skills for performing maintenance, repair, and related work on cars, trucks, buses, and motorcycles. In short, just about any vehicle except aircraft and mecha.
skill.name: Mechanic

skill.description: The academic study of mechanical parts and systems. This includes such things as machinery, controls, structural design, etc. A person with this skill would be adept at designing mechanical things, and analyzing the designs of others. This skill does NOT imply the ability to make a mechanical device.
skill.name: Mechanical Engineering

skill.description: Professional medicine. The study of the human body, its ailments, and how to treat them. Lvl 1 = Pre-Med Student, Lvl 2 = Med School Graduate--Resident, Lvl 3 = Inexperienced MD. You may choose the area of expertise
skill.name: Medical

skill.description: The ability to fix wounds 'in the field'. This can be done as a standard action.
skill.name: Medical Emergency
Military Strategy

skill.description: The ability to correctly assess the ability to mine a large, long, deep tunnel. How to go about digging the tunnel, and all the logistics and equipment needed for the mine.
skill.name: Mining

skill.description: The ability to play an instrument. Select what instrument when you pick this skill. This implies the ability to read music.
skill.name: Music

skill.description: See MYSTICISM section.
skill.name: Mysticism

skill.description: The knowledge of the myths, superstitions, and religious beliefs of past civilizations. This can be generic overall knowledge, or specific and in-depth in one particular area.
skill.name: Mythology

skill.description: How to plot and plan directions and courses in natural settings.
skill.name: Navigation

skill.description: The dispensing, dosage calculation, and selection of drugs. How to make pills or liquid medicines (from the raw medicine), and the knowledge of what existing drugs work for what ailments; knowledge of combined effects from mixing drugs, etc.
skill.name: Pharmacology

skill.description: Study of any particular type of philosophy or outlook on life (or general knowledge of several). Academic skill.
skill.name: Philosophy

skill.description: The skills associated with taking pictures. The selection and operation of cameras (still and video), use of lenses and filters, taking pictures in various different conditions, working with film, as well as developing and editing prints.
skill.name: Photography
Physics

skill.description: The repair and installation of piping, drains, and fixtures (sinks, bathtubs, water heaters, etc.) in and around buildings. Includes working with piping, fittings, etc. for both water and gas use.
skill.name: Plumbing

skill.description: Affinity for politics; knowledge of the political process, political groups and their agendas--public and private. The knowledge of current political events, deal making, vote gathering, and lobbying fall under this scope of this skill.
skill.name: Politics

skill.description: The academic study of Pisioncs; including how psionic powers work, what they do, and what their limitations are. This skill is NOT required to use psionic abilities.
skill.name: Psionic Studies

skill.description: Riding an animal. Select the type of animal for the skill. Common examples are horses, camels, elephants, etc. This skill can be taken for any riding animal. The skill also includes basic care, grooming and feeding of the animal.
skill.name: Riding

skill.description: The scientific knowledge and practical engineering experience associated with working on robots. Much like how a mechanic works on cars, a person with robotics is skilled at working on robots. This includes designing robots (greatly aided with mechanical and electrical engineering), and repairing or modifying them.
skill.name: Robotics

skill.description: Tying knots, working with ropes and cables for purposes of lifting and securing loads, etc. Sailors, dockworkers, crane crews, truckers, climbers, etc commonly possess this skill. Persons with this skill know what knots to use when and how to tie them. Also gives the character the knowledge on the suitability of ropes and cables for different applications.
skill.name: Ropes and Rigging

skill.description: The academic study of rune magic. No character may learn a rune spell of higher rank than his level of this skill. (See Rune Magic system...)
skill.name: Rune Magic

skill.description: The knowledge of how to use assist equipment for underwater diving. This includes SCUBA systems, air tanks, surface compressors, diving suits, and related devices. Persons with this skill will know how to avoid decompression sickness, how to communicate underwater by means of signals, and how to recover small to mid-sized objects underwater.
skill.name: SCUBA Diving

skill.description: Knowledge of sailboats and how to sail them. This includes setting up and working with sails and rigging, steering, etc. A person with this skill will have basic navigation knowledge, and knowledge of maritime laws.
skill.name: Sailing

skill.description: The ability to sell something. A person with this skill will be adept at marketing and promotion of goods and services, finding buyers, negotiating prices, etc.
skill.name: Sales

skill.description: Knowledge of how and where to look for items, but not from 'normal' sources. People with this skill are known for their ability to find just about anything--even if that means digging around in dumpsters, pawnshops, and similar locations.
skill.name: Scrounging

skill.description: The knowledge of how to protect persons, objects, and places. This includes use of security systems, surveillance equipment, and guard personnel. A person with this skill knows how to use these measures to protect things, and also recognizes their weaknesses, as well as common tactics used to breach them.
skill.name: Security

skill.description: The use of oneself to make other people to do what they want. This might include faking friendship or romantic interest, deceptive speech, and use of physical attractiveness.
skill.name: Seduction

skill.description: The ability to sing. This can be any type of music. This skill implies the ability to read music.
skill.name: Singing

skill.description: This skill includes things such as stage magic, palming things, concealment, etc. A person with this skill can perform various card tricks, other magic tricks, and would be skilled at palming objects, or making objects 'appear' from thin air. This could be used for tricks, stealing small objects, or concealing small weapons.
skill.name: Sleight of Hand
Smithing

skill.description: The skill of casting magical spells, invocation style. You cannot purchase a spell whose rank is higher than your level of this skill. It provides additional MP as well. See magic section for full information.
skill.name: Spellcasting

skill.description: Stealth gives the character the ability to move silently through his or her surroundings.
skill.name: Stealth

skill.description: The knowledge of how the streets 'work'; things like cants, where to find contacts, etc.
skill.name: Streetwise

skill.description: A variant of magic applied to calling forth animals and various creatures to assist the caster. See the Summoning Magic text for more information.
skill.name: Summoning

skill.description: The knowledge of little known or unusual mythology, especially that involving ghosts, monsters, undead, werewolves or vampires, etc. A person with this skill will have knowledge of various mythical (and real) beasts, monsters, etc. including their appearance, strengths--weaknesses, etc.
skill.name: Supernatural Lore

skill.description: The ability to find food, water, and shelter in most any situation. Includes making simple shelters (lean-tos, tents, stick houses, etc.), making a fire, collecting food and water, and avoiding harm from the elements (extreme temperatures), dangerous animals, etc.
skill.name: Survival

skill.description: Similar to Athletics, but specifically swimming and diving skills. Imparts the endurance and techniques to swim long distances, etc.
skill.name: Swimming

skill.description: The ability to teach skills you know to others.
skill.name: Teaching

skill.description: The knowledge of religion and how to argue about religion. Non-historical in nature.
skill.name: Theology

skill.description: Throwing things with accuracy and power. This could be a rock, baseball, grenade, or whatever. A person with this skill can throw things much more accurately and further than a normal person. (Note, this skill can be used in combat to strike with grenades or similar thrown weapons. However, throwing knives, shuriken, etc. are a different skill)
skill.name: Throwing

skill.description: The ability to follow something (animal, person, or vehicle) based on the signs it left behind. This includes such things as identifying and following tracks, finding hidden or covered tracks, and how to disguise tracks.
skill.name: Tracking

skill.description: The knowledge of unusual or generally useless facts like obscure history, sports stats, info about actors and actresses, etc. This is the kind of knowledge one would need to do well at trivia games, like Trivial Pursuit and Jeopardy.
skill.name: Trivia

skill.description: The ability to drive land-based vehicles other than automobiles or motorcycles. This would apply to things like heavy trucks, buses, tanks, construction equipment, forklifts, and other things.
skill.name: Vehicle Piloting
skill.occupation: Truck driver, construction worker, some soldiers

skill.description: The medicine skill applied to animals. See Medicine skill for more detail.
skill.name: Veterinary Medicine

skill.description: Knowledge of weapons design, suitability of weapons, and how to make weapons. In an archaic setting, this would include how to make simple weapons. In a modern setting, one could design weapons, but might not be able to build them (that might require such skills as mechanical or electrical engineering, machining, etc.)
skill.name: Weaponry

skill.description: This is effectively a specialization of the skill
skill.name: Whore

skill.description: Special skill. This can be thought of as a resume or work experience. It implies that you have work experience and higher levels mean you are a desirable employee. Talk to your GM about what this skill does for you.
skill.name: Work

skill.description: The ability to write convincing literary works. This could be poetry or prose, fiction or nonfiction. (This is NOT the skill of being literate. This is the skill of being a good writer).
skill.name: Writing

skill.description: Imparts the ability to control one's body movements effectively in low-G or zero-G environments such as in space, freefall, or underwater.
skill.name: Zero-G

skill.description: The academic study of animals; including their biology and their behavior, etc.
skill.name: Zoology

augmentation.description: One or more metal blades is inserted into the forearm. It can extend forward or swing out from the back of the arm. The blades are used with the small sword skill and can deal 1D6+2 S
augmentation.name: Arm Blades

augmentation.description: Special armor plating is inserted into the back of the forearm. This makes the forearm and effective tool for parrying melee attacks. Armor is 5/9/5
augmentation.name: Arm Guards

augmentation.description: A special set of hands designed to improve your ability to climb. -1 DEX for normal tasks. +4 to climbing rolls. When combined with Climbing Feet, bonus is a total of +6
augmentation.name: Climbing Hands

augmentation.description: Uses 5 Power, range of 150 feet
augmentation.name: Climbing System

augmentation.description: A semiautomatic gun, in any normal pistol caliber, can be concealed in the forearm
augmentation.name: Concealed Gun

augmentation.description: The ability to extend your arms up to twice their normal length. You have -3 STR with the arms fully extended. They can be extended and contracted at wll.
augmentation.name: Extendable Arms

augmentation.description: This device, when implanted into a hand, can be used to spray chemicals a short distance away. It can't store very much liquid, however.
augmentation.name: Finger Sprayer

augmentation.description: Concealed in a finger
augmentation.name: Garrote Wire

augmentation.description: This allows the user to lock his grip on an object. When locked, it requires 5 greater than the user's STR to un-break the grip. It also gives +5 to STR checks for holding onto an object.
augmentation.name: Grip Lock

augmentation.description: This modification gives your hands -1 DEX, but allows you to heat your palms to a significant temperatures. This can be used to deal 1D4 U damage in an attack, or for cooking food, etc.
augmentation.name: Heated Hand

augmentation.description: Gives 2 slots in either arm. 1 in upper arm, one in lower arm.
augmentation.name: Hollow Arm

augmentation.description: Adds +1 to punching damage
augmentation.name: Knuckle Spikes

augmentation.description: 1D6+1 S per shot for 2 Power
augmentation.name: Laser Finger

augmentation.description: An armored palm can be used as a shield to block attacks, etc. The palm has 6/8/4 armor after this modification.
augmentation.name: Palm Sheild

augmentation.description: A luminescent watch is implanted beneath the skin somewhere on the body. It is usually in the wrist area. It tells perfect time, and you can't ever loose it!
augmentation.name: Subdermal Watch

augmentation.description: Small tools, similar to a swiss army knife, are implanted into the hands. They aren't strong enough for tough jobs, but are very handy for light work. Includes a small knife, scissors, file, saw, various screwdrivers, bottle/can opener, etc.
augmentation.name: Tool Hands

augmentation.description: Robotic fingers can split apart into six individual micro-fingers. This allows one to type on a keyboard much faster than with normal hands. When in "typing mode", hand has a STR of 2.
augmentation.name: Typing Hands

augmentation.description: A modification to your joints. It enables a given joint to move in a manner in which it normally couldn't. (so, you could bend your knee backwards, for example)
augmentation.name: Abnormal Articulation

augmentation.description: Adds another orificice to the body (or adapts an existing one), enabling you to eat from it. Thus, it's possible to eat through your ear, etc.
augmentation.name: Alternate Digestive Orifice

augmentation.description: Improves your ability to survive and perform in odd enviornments, such as deserts, snow, high altitude, etc.
augmentation.name: Climate Adaptability

augmentation.description: A minor cosmetic modification to the body, such as skin ridges, changing the shape of part of the body, etc.
augmentation.name: Cosmetic Addition

augmentation.description: Makes your skin glow. You can turn it on and off at will
augmentation.name: Dermal Backlight

augmentation.description: Enables a certain joint in the body (knee, wrist, elbow, etc.) to be detached and re-connected at will. This enables you to switch limbs or "attachments" on your body.
augmentation.name: Detachable Joint

augmentation.description: Change the color of your skin. It can be changed to any color, or patterns, etc. Changing takes a few seconds.
augmentation.name: Dynochromatic Skin

augmentation.description: Makes healing your body and working on your cybernetics unusually easy. Downtime is reduced by half.
augmentation.name: Easy Maintenance

augmentation.description: Protects the body from electrical damage. Take only 50% damage from electrical attacks unless they originate from inside the body.
augmentation.name: Electrically Shielded Body

augmentation.description: Make yourself bleed at will, for no reason, and without harm. You can stop the false bleeding at will.
augmentation.name: False Bleeding

augmentation.description: Prevents the skin from burning in normal situations. You take half damage from short-term contact with fire.
augmentation.name: Fireproof Skin

augmentation.description: Enables you to "breate" water naturally. Usually installed on the neck, but could be anywhere. The Gills are a sensitive organ.
augmentation.name: Gills

augmentation.description: Enables you to control the look of your hair at will. This can do anything that normal hair styling can do, and affects the entire body
augmentation.name: Hair Control

augmentation.description: Hardens the skin all over your body. 3/0/0
augmentation.name: Hard Skin

augmentation.description: Upgrade the STR of your muscles. Can be purchased as many times as you want. Each purchase is +1 STR
augmentation.name: Increased STR for muscles

augmentation.description: Increases the amount of fast-twitch muscle fiber in your body. Gain +3 STR for fast applications, but suffer a -1 BLD. You also suffer and -3 STR for anything that takes longer than a second. -2 Enc
augmentation.name: Increased Twitch Fibers

augmentation.description: Improves the sensitivity of your skin. You can accuratley determine the shape, size, texture, and temperature of objects touching you.
augmentation.name: Increased perception (sense skin)

augmentation.description: Adds speed to your wings. Each purchase is +20 MPH
augmentation.name: Increased speed of Wings

augmentation.description: Change the color of your skin. It works fairly slowly, and can only be used to match normal "human color" skin. It can be white, black, "yellow". You can simulate tans, etc, but cannot do unnatural colors.
augmentation.name: Melanin Control

augmentation.description: Replace your muscles with superior lab-grown ones. +1 STR and +1 BLD
augmentation.name: Muscle replacement

augmentation.description: Muscle enhancement which improves motor control. Each purchase adds +1 DEX. Can be purchased more than once, but each consecutive purchase is twice the cost of the previous one.
augmentation.name: Myomer muscle fibers

augmentation.description: Replaces your nervous system (except the brain) with an electronic network.
augmentation.name: Nervous System replacement

augmentation.description: Enables you to shut off or dimininsh pain at your will
augmentation.name: Pain Editior

augmentation.description: Protects the body from radiation from outside sources. Will not protect you from ingesting radioactive materials, etc.
augmentation.name: Radiation Immunity

augmentation.description: Toughens your skeleton and improves how smoothly it moves, improving your BLD by 1 point
augmentation.name: Reenforced Skeleton

augmentation.description: A replacement for your normal skeleton. The bones are make of many individual joints, and can be bent at will. This enables you to perform amazing feats of contortion. +1 DEX -1 STR
augmentation.name: Replaced Skeleton (Flexible)

augmentation.description: A replacement for your normal skeleton. It has the ability to be locked rigid, giving you a +3 to STR contests, and an additional +1 BLD
augmentation.name: Replaced Skeleton (Rigid)

augmentation.description: Your blood vessels will seal themselves very effectivley if cut or otherwise damaged. You don't loose extra HP after going below 0, and don't bleed appreciably.
augmentation.name: Self Sealing Blood Vessels

augmentation.description: Makes your skin unusually slick and slightly slimy. It makes it very difficult for something to grab you (-3), and slashing weapons have a tendency to slide off. (0/3/0)
augmentation.name: Slick Skin

augmentation.description: Makes your skin tougher and thicker than normal. It cushions impact. (0/0/3)
augmentation.name: Spongy Skin

augmentation.description: Armored mesh is implanted below the skin. It is located everywhere execpt the face, groin, hands, and feet. Armor is 6/6/5. This is highly visible
augmentation.name: Subdermal Armor (heavy)

augmentation.description: Armored mesh is implanted below the skin. It is located everywhere execpt the face, groin, hands, and feet. Armor is 2/2/2. This is almost invisible
augmentation.name: Subdermal Armor (light)

augmentation.description: Armored mesh is implanted below the skin. It is located everywhere execpt the face, groin, hands, and feet. Armor is 4/4/4 this is visible if someone looks for it.,
augmentation.name: Subdermal Armor (med)

augmentation.description: A special network of neuro-activated wire actuators suspends your vital organs. If something penetrates your body, they pull your organs out of the way. Take 50% piercing damage. Only works if you are not wearing any armor.
augmentation.name: Suspended organs

augmentation.description: A tail is added to the body. It is thick and sturdy. It improves your balance, giving +3 to balance-related DEX checks.
augmentation.name: Tail (balancing)

augmentation.description: A tail is added to the body. It has sensation, but has no real use other than cosmetics.
augmentation.name: Tail (cosmetic)

augmentation.description: A tail is added to the body. It has DEX equal to your normal value. It can be used to hold onto things, etc. Also gives balance dex bonus
augmentation.name: Tail (prehensile)

augmentation.description: Enables you to secrete a weak poison from the skin. It is foul tasting, and deals 1D4-1 damage if ingested. Anything biting you must make a WILL check at -8 or immiedtly let go. (except robots, undead)
augmentation.name: Toxic Skin

augmentation.description: Addes blades to your wings that can be used as weapons. Use with unarmed combat. 3D6 damage.
augmentation.name: Wing blades

augmentation.description: Adds a set of wings to the body. They can be used to fly up to 20 MPH. Wings can retract inside the body for 2 slots and 6 more CP.
augmentation.name: Wings

augmentation.description: Hear a whisper from 100 meters away
augmentation.name: Advanced Audio

augmentation.description: Increases senses of taste and smell by 4 times.
augmentation.name: Advanced Olfactory System

augmentation.description: Increase sense of taste by 100 times
augmentation.name: Advanced Tasting

augmentation.description: Additional hole to breath from (can be anywhere on body)
augmentation.name: Alternate breathing passage

augmentation.description: Immune to flash and laser blinding
augmentation.name: Anti-Dazzle

augmentation.description: Gives + 1 to strike with ranged weapons
augmentation.name: Automatic Reticle

augmentation.description: +1 INT
augmentation.name: Brain Coprocessor

augmentation.description: Gives brain 10/10/10 armor
augmentation.name: Brain casing

augmentation.description: One language
augmentation.name: Built in Translator

augmentation.description: 2 hours of recording time
augmentation.name: Camera

augmentation.description: Detect Hormonal changes, sweat, lie detect (as if at level 4), etc...
augmentation.name: Chemical Identification

augmentation.description: must have 1 slot for fuel. 1D4 D, half damage against hard armor
augmentation.name: Cold Breath

augmentation.description: Change ears to look like anything you want
augmentation.name: Cosmetic Ear change

augmentation.description: Change the look of any/all portions of the eye. This can be color of the iris, pupil, or any other portion of the eye. This can also include glowing eyes. Permanent change.
augmentation.name: Cosmetic Eye Change

augmentation.description: Metallic hair, effect is cosmetic only
augmentation.name: Cyber hair

augmentation.description: Character can unhinge the jaw, allowing him or her to swallow objects up to 3 times normal size
augmentation.name: Detachable Jaw

augmentation.description: Range 2000'
augmentation.name: Directional Hearing

augmentation.description: Character can completely change his or her facial features, not including facial hair. This process takes a minute of concentration.
augmentation.name: Disguise Face (Facial Features)

augmentation.description: A device for stimulating the pleasure or pain centers of the brain directly.
augmentation.name: Droud

augmentation.description: Change the look of any/all portions of the eye. This can be color of the iris, pupil, or any other portion of the eye. This can also include glowing eyes. The look of the eyes can be changed at will, takes 15 seconds.
augmentation.name: Dynamic Eye Changing

augmentation.description: +1 WIS
augmentation.name: Dynamic Memory Chip

augmentation.description: Additional eye on body
augmentation.name: Extra Eye

augmentation.description: 1D6+1 S. Can be used once per round.
augmentation.name: Eye Laser

augmentation.description: The eyes can act like flashlights, emiting a beam of light up to 100' away
augmentation.name: Eye Lights

augmentation.description: The eyes can project a holographic image of anything the character wishes. The image is unmistakable for a hologram, and will fool only the most stupid into believing what they are seeing. Has no sound.
augmentation.name: Eye Projector

augmentation.description: The eyes can emit a bright flash, momentarily stunning those without an anti-dazzle system. Stunned victives are at -3 to all actions for 1D4 turns
augmentation.name: Eye flash

augmentation.description: Character can completely change his or her facial & head hair. This includes style, sparseness, color, and placement
augmentation.name: Facial Hair Control

augmentation.description: Teeth are not natural, and they feel no pain
augmentation.name: False teeth

augmentation.description: Cosmetic. But if character has the Strengthened Bite implant, then fangs add +3 damage and changes damage to P.
augmentation.name: Fangs

augmentation.description: must have 1 slot for fuel. 2D4 U
augmentation.name: Fire Breathing

augmentation.description: Inner ear replacement. 4x normal hearing
augmentation.name: Hearing System

augmentation.description: 20ft range. Detect exact temperature of surroundings.
augmentation.name: Heat Sensor

augmentation.description: 1D4 P damage, or 2D4 for 1 enc
augmentation.name: Horns

augmentation.description: Visualizes heat of objects
augmentation.name: Infra-Scanner

augmentation.description: Regenerates 1D4+1 HP per round. 1 Slot for power source
augmentation.name: Maxwell Board

augmentation.description: Acts as a file system for remembering things. It can store up to twenty-five different "memories". They can be accessed at will, and the information contained within will never be "forgotten".
augmentation.name: Memory Board

augmentation.description: +1 action per turn, only one
augmentation.name: Memory Buffer/Reclocker

augmentation.description: Increase magnification by up to 200 times but for only objects very close to character
augmentation.name: Microscopic Vision

augmentation.description: 100ft range
augmentation.name: Motion Detector

augmentation.description: +1 DEX in applications where speed isn't an issue (Delicate tasks, etc.). If you have a Flexible Skeleton, add +1 DEX all the time and an additional +1 DEX for slow tasks.
augmentation.name: Movement Board

augmentation.description: Can speak multiple things at once
augmentation.name: Multispeech

augmentation.description: GPS and map system
augmentation.name: Navigation System

augmentation.description: 1D4-1 P damage from hair (on head)
augmentation.name: Needle hair

augmentation.description: Immune to loud noises, and filters out background noise to hear someone in a noisy area
augmentation.name: Noise Filter

augmentation.description: 1 Shell in a nostril. Fired from trigger in mouth. Can be any automatic pistol caliber. Cost adds to the cost of the gun you want to use; min STR has -2 for this use.
augmentation.name: Nose gun

augmentation.description: Gives + 4 Brain slots. Only one can be used
augmentation.name: Octopus Board

augmentation.description: Allows for electronic output from brain to interface with electronics, computers, etc.
augmentation.name: Output Jack

augmentation.description: Deliver poison when bitting. 5 doses
augmentation.name: Posion Glands

augmentation.description: Cosmetic only. Has a 3 Strength, and a Dexterity of the user.
augmentation.name: Prehensile Tongue

augmentation.description: Allows the use of a single psionic power (must be purchased normally). Also opens character up to attacks from this type of psionic attack (assuming it's a mental attack)
augmentation.name: Psionic Board

augmentation.description: Acts like a geiger counter
augmentation.name: Radiation Detector

augmentation.description: 20 mile range
augmentation.name: Radio Receiver/Transmitter

augmentation.description: Remove eye from socket, wire connects to face
augmentation.name: Remote Eye

augmentation.description: A.I. reconstruction of the human brain. Work identically to a human brain. Contains 8 "brain slots" which may be utilized for special brain upgrades. Can be located anywhere in the body. Frees up 2 slots in head. The SRB takes up one slot, can be located anywhere.
augmentation.name: Slotted Robotic Brain (SRB)

augmentation.description: req. vocal system, range 500'
augmentation.name: Sonar

augmentation.description: Spit a poison up to 20'. 5 doses
augmentation.name: Spitting Glands

augmentation.description: Bite deals 1D4 C damage
augmentation.name: Strengthened Bite

augmentation.description: At will, the character can kill himself, just by desiring to die
augmentation.name: Suicide system

augmentation.description: Provides up to 40x normal vision
augmentation.name: Telescopic Vision

augmentation.description: Alows hearing of very high frequency sound, like an animal.
augmentation.name: Ultrasonic Pickup

augmentation.description: Can turn on and off at will. When on, it will provide +2 WIS, +2 INT, and +1 action for 1D4-1 turns. Then, it has the opposite effect for two turns, before it can be activated again.
augmentation.name: V-System Board

augmentation.description: Character can speak without opening the mouth.
augmentation.name: Ventriliquist System

augmentation.description: The eyes are replaced by mechanical versions that perform slightly better than their human counterparts. 4x normal vision
augmentation.name: Vision System

augmentation.description: Deal 2D4 C damage to a target up to 100' away
augmentation.name: Vocal Blast

augmentation.description: Stun all listeners of the screech for 1d4 turns. All those stunned lose an action for the duration.
augmentation.name: Vocal Screech

augmentation.description: Increase vocal range by 4 times. Gives a +4 to the singing skill.
augmentation.name: Vocal System

augmentation.description: Can change characters voice to any recorded voice
augmentation.name: Voice Modulator

augmentation.description: Increase or decrease volume by up to 10 times.
augmentation.name: Volume Control

augmentation.description: +1 perception rolls
augmentation.name: Whiskers

augmentation.description: Sees IR and UV Light reflections
augmentation.name: Wideband Camera

augmentation.description: A special set of feet designed to improve your ability to climb. -1 DEX for normal tasks. +4 to climbing rolls. When combined with Climbing hands, bonus is a total of +6
augmentation.name: Climbing Feet

augmentation.description: The feet are made unusually durable. They will not develop blisters nor get tired, even when doing heavy work. Stubbing a toe or having your feet stepped on will no longer be as painful and is much less likely to cause injury.
augmentation.name: Durable Feet

augmentation.description: The ability to extend your legs up to twice their normal length. You have -3 STR with the legs fully extended. They can be extended and contracted at wll.
augmentation.name: Extendable Legs

augmentation.description: Retractible metal blades are implanted into the foot. They give +1 damage to kicks and deal S damage.
augmentation.name: Foot Blades

augmentation.description: The sole of the foot is toughened with implants. This eliminates the need to wear shoes. You can walk on any normal terrain without hurting your feet. They can also be used to block attacks (if you are sufficiently skilled). The sole has 4/5/3 armor.
augmentation.name: Foot Sheild

augmentation.description: Small rocket engines implanted into the foot allow you to jump 50% further than normal. They can also be used to accelerate the movement of the foot during a kick, adding +5 raw damage. Six uses before recharging.
augmentation.name: Foot Thrusters

augmentation.description: A metal spike is implanted into the heel. It makes it easier to run, walk, etc. on slippery surfaces. It also deals extra damage with kicks or stomps. (+1, P)
augmentation.name: Heel Spike

augmentation.description: Gives 3 slots in either leg. (two in thigh and one in calf)
augmentation.name: Hollow leg

augmentation.description: Can leap 10+3*X feet vertically or horizontally.
augmentation.name: Jumping ability

augmentation.description: A metal spike is implanted into the knee. It can be used to deal 1D6+1 P damage. It also protects the kneecap from injury.
augmentation.name: Knee Spike

augmentation.description: Gives 5 additional MPH per purchase. Can be bought 4 times without needing space. Beyond that, every 4 purchases requires a slot.
augmentation.name: Speed increase

augmentation.description: An improved digestive system. It allows you to eat and digest things that would normally have little nutriutional value. This includes stringy vegitation, wood, paper, hard meat, leather, etc. Also extracts more nutrition out of normal foods.
augmentation.name: Advanced Digestive Sys

augmentation.description: Protective armor applied to the crotch area. It elimiates the groin as an effective target in combat. Armor is 5/5/5
augmentation.name: Armored Crotch

augmentation.description: Allows you to breathe effectivley in "bad" enviornments, such as smoke, steam, or chemical vapors. It won't create oxygen out of nowhere, but it will filter out mild and some moderate irritants and hazardous substances.
augmentation.name: Breathing Filter

augmentation.description: Any pistol-caliber can be used. The gun is semiautomatic and is hidden in the groin area. Cost adds to the cost of the gun you pick. STR requirement is normal.
augmentation.name: Crotch Gun

augmentation.description: The throat can expand to much larger than it's normal size. This allows one to swallow large objects without a problem.
augmentation.name: Dilating Throat

augmentation.description: Makes the genitals less sensitive to pain, damage, and disease. Improves sexual stamina, and elimiates chafing!
augmentation.name: Durable Genitalia

augmentation.description: Improved kidneys allow you to eat spolied or rotten food that would otherwise make you ill. They remove toxins from the blood very effectivley.
augmentation.name: Hyper Kidneys

augmentation.description: Improves your ability to breathe under duress. You don't have to gasp or breathe hard when doing strenuous activity. Gives a +3 to BLD checks for strenuous activity.
augmentation.name: Improved Breathing

augmentation.description: A complex modification that enables things to be moved throughout the body. It can be used to remove embedded objects (splinters, bullets, etc.) this can be used with an internal storage compartment. Example: swallow a key and have it appear in the compartment.
augmentation.name: Internal Cavity Trans Sys

augmentation.description: Allows one to control one's metabolism. This can be used to maintain a certain weight and to govern sleep cycles, etc.
augmentation.name: Metabolic Controller

augmentation.description: A small implant stores hyper-concentrated vitamins an minerals from when your body has a surplus and saves them for later, when needed. This allows the body to be healthy when eating poor food for extended periods of time.
augmentation.name: Nutrient Storage

augmentation.description: Enables the user to elimiate his or her natural scent. It also effects burps and flatulence, etc.
augmentation.name: Odor Masking

augmentation.description: A small tank implanted in the body is used to store compressed 3 hours worth of oxygen. It can be used to breathe anywhere. If the tank is destroyed, when full, it explodes and deals 6D6+3 damage to the host.
augmentation.name: Oxygen Storage

augmentation.description: Adds significant dexterity to the genitals. This is used to enhance sexual pleasure.
augmentation.name: Prehensile Genitalia

augmentation.description: +1 slot in torso
augmentation.name: Reduced Cardiovascular Sys

augmentation.description: +2 slot in torso
augmentation.name: Reduced Digestive Sys

augmentation.description: +1 slot in torso
augmentation.name: Reduced Respitory Sys

augmentation.description: Duplciates the effect of a vital organ (pick one). If the original is damaged, this takes over, saving your life.
augmentation.name: Redundant Vital System

augmentation.description: Normally used for males only. The genitals can be "pulled up" into the body to protect them from harm. Can also be used for disguise purposes.
augmentation.name: Retractible Genitals

augmentation.description: A modification to the lungs that enables them to seal themselves if punctured. If your lungs are wounded, you suffer no special effects.
augmentation.name: Sealing Lungs

augmentation.description: Enables the user to self-destruct his body and cause serious damage in the process. Deals 5x 6D6+3 to a 20' radius. Kills the character.
augmentation.name: Self Destruct Bomb

augmentation.description: enables the user to change his sexual appearance. The "change" takes less than a minuite, and can make a man look like a woman, or vice versa, even when totally naked. It does NOT actually change the user's sex, just the appearance.
augmentation.name: Sex Changer

augmentation.description: Makes the body quiet. It cancels the sound of the heartbeat, breathing, etc.
augmentation.name: Silent Running

augmentation.description: A compartment is installed in the body. It can be accessed by opening a door on the body. It can store something a little bigger than a soda can.
augmentation.name: Storage Compartment

augmentation.description: Makes the body appear room temperature.
augmentation.name: Thermal Masking

augmentation.description: takes a slot. The tank can be filled with anything you can swallow. At a later time, you can spew the contents of the tank forth, out your mouth.
augmentation.name: Vomit Tank

augmentation.description: An upgrade to the digestive tract finds a way to use ALL the substances you ingest. It all but eliminates the need to excrete waste.
augmentation.name: Waste Eliminator

augmentation.description: Enables the recipient to control his or her weight. By thinking about it, the user can add or remove fat quite quickly. Up to one pound per minuite. When gaining weight, the user must ingest something for the weight to come from (e.g. food)
augmentation.name: Weight Control

ammunition.description: A special type of arrowhead designed to penetrate heavy armor. They are expensive and time-consuming to produce, and therefore generally rare for military use (at least by common soldiers). The forged and hardened point is square or triangular in profile, carefully ground into a very sharp point.
ammunition.name: Anti-armor (arrows only!)

ammunition.description: Common for hunting small game (especially birds), and also used for war. This is a standard arrow (bullet point) with several metallic barbs embedded in the head. It is difficult to remove, causing additional damage when it is pulled out of the target.
ammunition.name: Barbed

ammunition.description: These are the most effective hunting arrows. They aren't great at penetrating heavy armor, but are excellent for causing additional damage to the target. This is particularly desirable for hunting, because it is likely to kill or incapacitate the target animal quickly, even if the vital organs are missed. A broadhead is a wide, diamond-shaped head that has two or more ``fins'' on it that are sharpened into blades---which cut a devastating wound in the target.
ammunition.name: Broadhead (hunting)

ammunition.description: The ``standard'' type of arrow point. The tip is pointed, but somewhat blunt, like a rifle bullet. They are used for hunting small game, and for target shooting. They are also common arrows for some military use since they are easily and cheaply produced.
ammunition.name: Bullet Point

ammunition.description: A common military arrowhead. This is also the most common type of dart. The head is made of steel, and fashioned into a narrow cone---much like a pencil. These types of arrows are generally not used for hunting, but are very effective for wartime use.
ammunition.name: Bullet Point (blunt--target)

ammunition.description: A rare arrow design, which features a hollow head packed with gunpowder or other light explosive. When it strikes the target, it makes a small explosion. This has excellent damage potential. Unfortunately, the large, fragile, head makes this type of arrow poor at penetrating armor.
ammunition.name: Explosive

ammunition.description: fragile
ammunition.name: Explosive Point

ammunition.description: 9 AP
ammunition.name: Field Point (penetration)

ammunition.description: 5AP, has fire effect, light before shooting.
ammunition.name: Fire Arrow

ammunition.description: An arrow that is coated with cloth soaked in pitch, tar, kerosene, or some similar flammable material. It is set alight before firing. These arrows are commonly used for sending signals, and for setting enemy structures on fire---however, they are also effective for setting enemy soldiers on fire.
ammunition.name: Fire Point

armor.description:
ALCAR plate is heavy armor developed for use in military and SWAT applications. It consists of a helmet, long-sleeved jacket and pants.
The suit is made of heavy ballistic nylon which is covered with form-fitting ALuminum-CARbon plates which cover the vast majority of the body.
armor.name: ALCAR Plate

armor.description:
Articulated plate represents the finest acheivement of the blacksmith-armorer. It consists of a full suit of form-fitting and overlapping metal plates that cover the entire body from head to toe. The superior joints in articulated plate provide much better mobility than standard full plate.
Articulated plate must be made specifically for a given wearer.
armor.name: Articulated Plate

armor.description:
This armor was developed for strategic depolyment by special forces soldiers and elite personal security details. It offers superior protection to armors of similar weight.
This armor consists of a Spectra sleeved vest and matching pants. The entire suit is covered with polymeric plates reenforced with boron nanotubes. The thickness and shape of the plates is optimized to provide good mobility and protection.
armor.name: BSP Linked Plate Armor

armor.description: Heavy bulletproof vest with a trauma plate in the chest area.
armor.name: Ballistics Cloth (Heavy)

armor.description: A very light bulletproof vest. This is typically used by undercover police or anyone that needs unobtrusive protection.
armor.name: Ballistics Cloth (Light)

armor.description: A typical Kevlar bulletproof vest. Very commonly issued to soldiers and police.
armor.name: Ballistics Cloth (Standard)
Banded Mail

armor.description: Leather armor made from special leather from wilderness beasts. Scarce.
armor.name: Beast Leather

armor.description: Leather suit worn by motorcycle racers. The suit is specially tailored to fit the rider while in the ridng position. This, size is considered to be zero when the rider is on a motorcycle.
armor.name: Biker's Leathers

armor.description:
This high-tech armor is typically marketed to private security and mercenaries as it is generally too heavy for use by typical police or military forces. It consists of incredibly tough dual-phase plate armor over a spectra inner suit.
This armor is exceptionally resistant to battle damage and is capable of absorbing a remarkable amount of damage before becoming unusuable.
armor.name: Boron-Ceramic Plate

armor.description: Brigandine armor is made from a heavy cloth or supple leather tunic that is fitted with a regular pattern of rectangular iron plates. It covers the body from the neck to the thighs, and also covers the shoulder area.
armor.name: Brigandine

armor.description:
CLAF armor is the trade name for "Cross-Linked Aramid Fiber". This armor is a technologically superior "bulletproof vest" which covers the chest, torso, and groin area.
CLAF armor is common amongst police in affluent precincts and is also issued to some frontline infantry troops.
armor.name: CLAF Suit

armor.description:
CLB-WAF, called "Clubwaf" by it's wearers, is the most effective "bulletproof vest" developed. It consists of a Spectra-boron nanocomposite thread that is woven into armored cloth.
This armor delivers remarkable protection but is light enough to be used by beat cops and common soldiers.
armor.name: CLB--WAF Suit

armor.description:
This is the modern equivalent of plate mail armor. Unlike it's historical equivalent, this armor is made of lightweight composites. It also incorporates flexible joints which means that it is nearly universal in fitment.
It consists of high saturation 3D carbon fiber matix plates impregnated with semimetallic resins.
This armor is typically used by SWAT and Military units.
armor.name: Carbon Fiber Plate

armor.description:
Ceramic Plate armor was developed as an outgrowth of vehicle armor research. Ceramic Plate consists of large, scuplted plates that closely fit the body. The joints are unarmored.
Though it is an uncommon choice for military or police use, it is very popular amonst freelance mercenaries and adventurers due to its excellent fire resistance.
armor.name: Ceramic Plate

armor.description:
[LaTeX]
Chain mail consists of an armored vest (Hauberk) and pants. The armor is a very flexible fabric that is made of thousands of interlocking metal rings.
Typically this is worn over padded armor as the rings are known for chafing against bare skin.
\VBoxColumnPicture{Images/Equipment/Armor/Morgan_Bible_28r_detail.jpg}
armor.name: Chain Mail

armor.description: A chain mail suit covered with thick metal plates
armor.name: Chain and Brigandine

armor.description: Heavy clothing designed especially for protection--like a woodsman's coveralls, etc.
armor.name: Cloth

armor.description: Heavy hard armor carrying collapsed abotex plates. Exceedingly rare.
armor.name: Densematter Plate

armor.description: Similar to chain mail, but a superior design with a higher denisty of rings.
armor.name: Double Mail

armor.description: A superior form of chain mail made from exceptionally small metal rings that are interlinked in three dimensions.
armor.name: Elven Chain Mail

armor.description: A fine suit of plate armor. It is made of exotic metals and has finely fitted joints to improve mobility.
armor.name: Elysian Plate

armor.description: Hard armor composed of fiberglass-epoxy plates over a kevlar interior
armor.name: Fiberglass Plate

armor.description: A chain mail suit covered with thick, form-fitting heavy metal plates
armor.name: Field Plate aka 3/4 plate

armor.description: A heavy synth coat covered with hundreds of small hexagonal CERMET plates
armor.name: Fishback Ceramic

armor.description: A heavy denim coat covered with hundreds of small hexagonal metal tiles
armor.name: Fishback Steel
Flak Armor

armor.description: Metallurgically improved plate armor. It is the same encumberance but provides better protection.
armor.name: Forged Plate

armor.description: A full chain mail suit completely covered with form fitting heavy steel plates
armor.name: Full Plate

armor.description: cold weather clothing made from leather and animal furs
armor.name: Furs

armor.description: Highly advanced semimetallic armor oriented on the molecular level
armor.name: G-Alloy Plate

armor.description: A snazzy, gray, woolen, formal vest. It is somewhat bulky, but very debonair. Adds +1 to all Build-related skills. A magical item.
armor.name: Gentleman's Vest

armor.description: martial arts costume
armor.name: Gi

armor.description: Heavy hard armor made from hard-cast semimetallic composite plates
armor.name: HC Aramid Armor

armor.description: martial arts costume
armor.name: Hakama (cotton)

armor.description: martial arts costume
armor.name: Hakama (silk)

armor.description: A chain mail suit sparcely covered with thick, non-interlocking plates
armor.name: Half Plate

armor.description: Similar to soft leather, except that the main pieces are made of hard tooled leather
armor.name: Hard Leather

armor.description: Any sort of unusually thick clothing--like a parka, leather jacket, heavy denim, etc.
armor.name: Heavy Jacket

armor.description: A suit of fully enclosed metal plate armor. The plates are thicker than normal for superior protection.
armor.name: Heavy Plate

armor.description: A cloak made of heavy cloth secured with leather straps. The surface is covered with small stones and bits of metal bonded and sewn in place.
armor.name: Jack/gravel coat

armor.description: armored clothing made from pure kevlar with normal cloth over it. Designed to be inconspicuous. (used by diplomats, etc.)
armor.name: Kevlar

armor.description: Armor made from weaving steel wire into cloth
armor.name: Knitted Steel

armor.description: A partial plate suit. It consists of a breast plate, shoulder plates and greaves. The plates are cut to maximize movement.
armor.name: Light Plate

armor.description: secondary armor for millitary applications--a network of metal plates over a cloth vest
armor.name: Linked Metal

armor.description: Thin armor material that is nearly impossible to cut
armor.name: Mylar

armor.description: Tough clothing made from NOMEX fibers---designed for fire protection. Worn by firefighters and emergency workers
armor.name: Nomex

armor.description: Millitary armor made from tough armored fibers and composite plastics
armor.name: PACA Mesh suit

armor.description: Same as the above, with additional polymeric plates in key areas. This is the heaviest armor used by ultramodern SWAT forces.
armor.name: PLCALF Armor

armor.description: Heavy clothing lined with multiple layers of thick fur, padding, etc.
armor.name: Padded

armor.description: Light hard armor made from advanced polymeric plates over a kevlar suit
armor.name: Polymer Plate

armor.description: Polymeric hard armor containing steel inserts in all plates
armor.name: R-Polymer Plate

armor.description: Rubber-impregnated polyester fabric filled with dogbone-shaped interlocking metal bars. Protects against chemicals too.
armor.name: RIR Hazard Suit

armor.description: Full body jumpsuit made of fireproof materials. Designed to save the life of race car drivers, pilots, etc, in the event of a crash or fire.
armor.name: Racer's Suit/Pilot's suit

armor.description: Very hard and stiff leather with inlaid metal reinforcements. The edges are ringed in metal.
armor.name: Reinforced Leather

armor.description: Large metal rings held together with leather straps
armor.name: Ring Mail

armor.description: Standard SWAT armor: Ballistics cloth with metal plates in key locations
armor.name: Riot Armor

armor.description: Boron-composite plates over a spectra undersuit. Rare, generally used by special forces or elite units.
armor.name: SEB Hard Armor

armor.description: Improved version of Kevar, very flexible yet stands up well to piercing and slashing
armor.name: SPECTRA

armor.description: A heavy bulletproof vest made from the improved SPECTRA material with a steel chestplate
armor.name: SPECTRA Tactical Vest

armor.description: Hard leather armor covered in overlapping metal scales
armor.name: Scale Mail

armor.description: A chain mail suit with additional metal scales covering the chain material
armor.name: Scale-over-Chain

armor.description: Armored robes made from woven silk threads.
armor.name: Silk

armor.description: Armored clothing made of pieces of thick, soft, leather sewn together
armor.name: Soft Leather

armor.description: A shock-damping suit made from a special rubber material
armor.name: Sorbothene

armor.description: Soft leather armor covered with paralell vertical bands of iron
armor.name: Splint Mail

armor.description: A modern version of full plate mail
armor.name: Steel Plate

armor.description: Soft leather underlayment with multiple layers of hard leather straps held on by metallic buckles or rings. Creaks and makes noise when moving.
armor.name: Stripped-Leather Mail

armor.description: martial arts costume
armor.name: Tai Chi suit

armor.description: Armor made of hundreds of toad-skins stitched together. This may be worn either inside or outside of armor as it is quite suppled and billowing. The armor provides protection against poisons and acids, as long as it is not punctured. Even though the armor is considered "Hard" it does not count as "Hard" for sizing and encumbrance purposes.
armor.name: Toad Armor

armor.description: Special leather made from the hide of rare and dangerous monsters is used to make this superior type of armor.
armor.name: Wyrmhide

melee.description: The tool of a professional woodsman. The double-headed axe offers more weight and a backup cutting edge to help power through wood chopping chores. It also proved more effective on the battlefield than standard axes.
melee.name: 2-Headed Axe

melee.description: A typical axe---a tool for chopping and spitting wood. Many conscripted soldiers found their farm axes to be devastating in combat, often proving more effective than some swords.
melee.name: Axe

melee.description: The strongest Nordic warriors often wielded huge, oversized, versions of the their typical war axe. Equipped with a double-edge head and a design that concentrates most of the blade weight towards the end of the weapon, the Berzerker axe is unequaled for damage potential. However, its massive size limits its use to the strongest heroes.
melee.name: Berzerker Axe

melee.description: A tough, heavier, superior version of a normal axe designed for enabling rescue crews to quickly enter buildings. The fireman's axe has a spike on the back of the axe-head, enabling it to be used as a piercing weapon as well.
melee.name: Firemans Axe

melee.description: A small axe used for breaking up firewood and light-duty farmwork. Though not intended as a tool of war, hatchets served many a warrior as a backup weapon.
melee.name: Hatchet

melee.description: Some of the strongest medieval knights depended on heavy battle axes to deliver maximum damage to their enemies, human or otherwise. The heavy battle axe is designed for the roughest combat conditions, equipped with a massive, broad, head---and the weight to carry it through it's target.
melee.name: Heavy Battle Axe

melee.description: An adaptation of a wood-chopping tool to an implement of war. Light enough to be carried by most soldiers, yet capable of dealing high amounts of damage, light battle axes were favored weapons of many medieval armies.
melee.name: Light Battle Axe

melee.description: An oversized battle-axe subscribing to the idea that more weight equals more damage---and rightly so. The Lochaber axe's massive blade deals huge damage, and the spiked backside can deal a very nasty piercing attack.
melee.name: Lochaber Axe

melee.description: Developed by the fiercest Norse barbarian tribes, this is a simple yet fearsome weapon. Forged from the superior steels of the northern countries, the huge swept blade would easily cleave armor and limbs alike, and the carved handle provided for a very controllable swing. Many Norse warriors named their war-axes such things as ``widowmaker'' or ``swordbreaker''.
melee.name: Nordic War Axe

melee.description: A common tool for mining, digging, and general construction applications. The pickaxe is a heavy tool with a large, pointed, head. It is effective for breaking up rocks during mining, and breaking up armor in combat.
melee.name: Pickaxe

melee.description: A simple yet effective weapon, consisting of a wooden handle capped with a round iron or bronze head.
melee.name: Arab Mace

melee.description: +1 to parry using this weapon
melee.name: Cane--Lathi

melee.description: A simple piece of wood or metal used to beat your opponent into submission. Think baseball.
melee.name: Club

melee.description: A wooden club, traditionally made from a gnarled tree branch or root.
melee.name: Cudgel

melee.description: A normal household hammer. You never know when you might need to use one as a backup weapon.
melee.name: Hammer

melee.description: +3 to parry, no penalty to parry heavy weapons
melee.name: Iron Cane

melee.description: A common European weapon. The mace proved an effective weapon against opponents wearing chain mail or other soft armor. It is basically a club with a metal facing, often studded.
melee.name: Mace

melee.description: A tool for splitting logs, often adapted for combat purposes to split skulls. The maul is a wedge-shaped iron head mounted to a long handle.
melee.name: Maul
