melee.description: Cannot be used to parry.
melee.name: Sjambok

melee.description: A large hammer, typically used for construction work---and sometimes conscripted as a weapon. A sledgehammer has an iron head weighing several pounds mounted atop a long wooden handle.
melee.name: Sledge Hammer

melee.description:
[LaTeX]
A very easy-to-make weapon consisting of a cord with a weight on the end. A slungshot is used much like a yo-yo. It is not a chained weapon because of it's use: straight-line shots. The range of the weapon can be up to 10 feet. Specialists may use a variant called a ``loaded sleeve'' which is a modification of long robe-sleeves to use the weapon. As an Exotic weapon, the slungshot may be used twice in a single action.
melee.name: Slungshot

melee.description: A common sidearm of police and security personnel throughout the ages. It consists of a metal or wooden bar, about 18'' long, equipped with a handle mounted at 90 degrees to the bar, one third of the way down. It is quick to swing, and can deal crushing blows. As well, it is effective at blocking enemy attacks.
melee.name: Tonfa or Truncheon

melee.description: Heavy metal brass knuckles, shaped like a ``D''; made by Rock Trolls. Can be used as Blunt or Body (punch). Can cast any of the following spells, but only one of the spells per day
melee.name: Boxing Irons of the Troll

melee.description: A piece of metal designed to fit inside a closed fist. It usually has spikes that protrude between the fingers, or rings that surround the fingers---allowing one to deal more damage with punches.
melee.name: Brass Knuckles

melee.description: Similar to brass knuckles. This is a leather or fabric strap covered with metal studs that is wrapped around the fighter's hands and wrists.
melee.name: Cestus

melee.description: These gloves were owned by Julius Creese of the Church of St. Simon. Similar gloves have been used by important members of the church in times past, though their mothod of manufacture has been lost. A pair of whilte cloth gloves. The gloves are heavily starched and have a bright white color despite their age and lack of care. EAch glove has a large cuff that surrounds the wrist ofthe wearer. The left glove has black text reading ``Speak With The Dead'' superimposed over a cross imprinted onto the back of the hand. The right glove has text reading ``Saint Simon is in Heaven Now.'' These gloves have the following properties, which only work if both glvoes are worn
melee.name: Gloves of Anointing and Retribution

melee.description: These are leather gloves which have lead or steel shot sewn into the back of the fingers and hand. This protects the wearer's hands in a fight, and the extra weight deals extra damage. They are commonly used by bouncers, security personnel, and police forces.
melee.name: Sap Glove

melee.description: Fairly self-explanatory. These are heavy-duty boots with metal studs or spikes embedded in the toe area---perfect for delivering a thorough ass kicking.
melee.name: Studded or Spiked boots

melee.description: An iron ball, often spiked, attached by a length of chain to a handle.
melee.name: Ball and Chain

melee.description: A fairly long chain equipped with weights on either end---very effective for striking an opponent, and then entangling him.
melee.name: Chain (weapon)

melee.description: A length of iron chain suitable for striking an opponent with.
melee.name: Chain - Normal

melee.description: A length of chain that is periodically set with spikes or blades. A fairly unusual weapon, but one that is capable of causing serious damage in skilled hands.
melee.name: Chain with spikes--blades

melee.description: Originally a grain-threshing tool. A flail consists of a stout handle capped with a hinged (or shortly chained) iron head, often studded.
melee.name: Flail

melee.description: A common weapon of martial artists. Usually carried in pairs, nunchaku consist of two wooden or iron bars linked with a short chain. Though compact, they can deal devastating crushing blows.
melee.name: Nunchaku

melee.description: A variant of the flail designed for harsh combat. The war flail has a thick handle, and is equipped with three or more spiked iron balls on chains. It is a heavy and unwieldy weapon, but is very powerful.
melee.name: War Flail

melee.description: The Atalatl is a device that is used to throw spears with greater power than a typical throw. It is used with short spears.
melee.name: Atalatl

melee.description:
The Cicada Wing Blade is a Chinese weapon that is held like a staff. It has a central handle, two large blades at either end, and two smaller blades that protrude from the blade-handle junctions.
+1 to parry. Counts as double weapon
melee.name: Cicada Wing Blade

melee.description: +1 to parry
melee.name: Crescent Knives (pair)

melee.description: Gives bonus to climbing skill
melee.name: Iron Claws (pair)

melee.description: 5 AP
melee.name: Jumonji Yari

melee.description: Cannot parry large weapons
melee.name: Kris Datoh

melee.description: Literally ``Hammer of Iron'', this is the largest of the hammer type weapons. It's fifty-pound iron head requires a true brute to swing, but woe to those who would be in its path.
melee.name: Martel de Fer

melee.description: Counts as Holy Symbol
melee.name: Monks Spade

melee.description: Chain rules apply. Easily concealed.
melee.name: Nine-section Chain

melee.description: The largest of the Japanese swords. No-Dachi have blades that exceed 40'' in length. The entire sword is considerably longer. They are strongly curved, and were worn slung across the back. Though they require significant space to swing, there is no more powerful sword in the world. A warrior with such a weapon would have no problem cleaving a man in half.
melee.name: No-Dachi

melee.description: +2 to parry using this weapon
melee.name: Ox Ear Knives (pair)

melee.description: A farming implement that is fairly effective for combat use; typically used in pairs. Sai are slender metal rods with large handguards. They can deal strong blows in combat, and are very effective for deflecting and intercepting enemy attacks.
melee.name: Sai (pair)

melee.description: An ingenious sword with a C-shaped curved blade. It is very effective at reaching behind an enemy's shield. A skilled fighter with this weapon will succeed in striking his target very frequently.
melee.name: Shortel

melee.description: +2 to parry. -2 to defend against
melee.name: Three Section Staff

melee.description: A variant of the standard Tanto. This knife has a triangular profile and very thick, narrow blade. It is designed to pierce heavy armor, but is also a great slashing weapon. It takes an unusually skilled smith to forge this kind of Tanto, thus it is a rare and expensive knife.
melee.name: Yoroidoshi Tanto

melee.description: The Japanese equivalent of the Long bow. It is of composite design and is very large. The Yumi is unusual because the grip is located two-thirds of the way down the bow, rather than in the center, and it is fired with the bow leaning forward. This means that it requires a very high ceiling to fire a Yumi indoors. The design of this bow makes it extremely powerful---easily capable of defeating heavily armored opponents. Unfortunatley, it is very large and therefore it can be difficult to transport.
melee.name: Yumi

melee.description: An Indian weapon, somewhat of a cross between a hammer, axe, and a pick. It appears much like a normal axe, but is equipped with a slender triangular-shaped head that offers it great flexibility as a weapon.
melee.name: Zaghnal

melee.description: A butcher's cleaver, or combat variation thereof. It is a large, heavy, blade with a razor sharp edge. It has a short reach, but is devastatingly effective for chopping-type attacks. It is useless for stabbing.
melee.name: Cleaver

melee.description: A combat knife, typically with a slender blade and a hand guard. A standard backup weapon for most soldiers.
melee.name: Dagger

melee.description: Also called a Quatar or punch dagger. It consists of a handle mounted perpendicular to the blade, often in a ``T'' shape. The handle is gripped in a closed fist, with a triangular blade extending forward. It is used in a punching motion.
melee.name: Katar

melee.description: -3 to parry
melee.name: Knife

melee.description: A Southeast Asian knife, as carried by the Gurkha regiments of India. This is a large weapon, nearly the size of a machete. The blade has a strong downward angle. It is nearly useless for stabbing, but is a very effective weapon and chopping tool. A well made kukri is just as effective as a small axe for chopping.
melee.name: Kukri

melee.description: A special variety of fighting knife. The slender blade is longer than 8'', and sharpened along both edges. This is among the largest weapons in this category---and is effective for both stabbing and slashing.
melee.name: Long Knife

melee.description: A knife with a scalloped or otherwise serrated edge. The serrations are very effective for damaging flesh, but reduce the knife's effectiveness at penetrating hard materials.
melee.name: Serrated knife

melee.description: This would be a typical pocketknife, ``Swiss army knife'', or any knife with a short blade. Not very effective as a weapon, but easy to conceal---and a decent backup.
melee.name: Small Knife

melee.description: Not so much a knife, but a slender metal spike with a handle. It cannot cut things, but is an excellent stabbing weapon, easily penetrating many types of armor. It does not deal much damage, so it is frequently used with poisons, or with called shots to vital organs.
melee.name: Stiletto

melee.description: A Japanese knife forged in the traditional style. The blade is formed from multiple layers of different steels. Tanto are unusually well balanced, and are exceptionally effective slashing weapons. It has a very small hand guard.
melee.name: Tanto

melee.description: This is the typical sword of the medieval knight. It is designed to be wielded with one or two hands, and can be used my most people.
melee.name: Bastard Sword

melee.description: Another common European sword. This weapon has a fairly short, wide, blade.
melee.name: Broadsword

melee.description: A famous weapon of Scottish origin. This blade requires a very strong person to wield---even two handed, but deals impressive damage to match. Claymores generally have a blade 5..6 feet long. The long reach of the claymore makes it effective for engaging multiple targets at once.
melee.name: Claymore

melee.description: A slender Spanish sword, rather like a large saber. Many of the world's greatest swordsmen relied upon this weapon to quell their foes.
melee.name: Espandon
Flamberge

melee.description: A weapon with exceptional deadliness and grace. The five-foot blade requires a very strong warrior to wield, but reciprocates with exceptional damage potential.
melee.name: Grand Saber

melee.description: The largest traditional sword. The grand sword appears much like a great sword, only larger. It is sufficiently heavy that only a mighty warrior might wield it, but is nearly indestructible---and is only matched by the No-Dachi in combat effectiveness.
melee.name: Grand Sword

melee.description: A huge version of the typical medieval sword. This is a massive weapon, with a blade several feet long, and a thickness and width to match. Few foes are a match for a warrior who can wield this massive weapon.
melee.name: Great Sword

melee.description: The typical weapon of the Samurai warrior. The Katana is a long sword worn alongside a Wakizashi. The blade is generally around 24..30 inches in length, and is shaped to be a natural extension of the warrior's arm. Like the Wakizashi, the superior edge of this weapon makes it fearsome in combat. A true Katana wielded by a skilled warrior can cut through a steel pipe or a large wooden post.
melee.name: Katana

melee.description: A favored weapon of medieval heroes. The long sword is a slender weapon with deadly reach.
melee.name: Long Sword

melee.description: Not so much a sword as a sword-shaped club. A massive piece of steel weighing in excess of forty pounds, few foes can withstand a blow from this weapon.
melee.name: Massive Sword

melee.description: Target must win STR contest to block or parry
melee.name: Ram Dao

melee.description: A more ancient Japanese sword. The Tachi is longer than a Katana, with a blade of around 34 or more inches long. Worn much like a European sword, this weapon offers exceptional power to a warrior who can wield it. It's is nearly impossible to use indoors due to it's length.
melee.name: Tachi

melee.description: The Tai Chi sword is an Asian weapon whose goal is grace and accuracy rather than raw mass and power. The weapon has a narrow, double-edged blade and is equipped with a strung counterweight on the pommel
melee.name: Tai Chi sword

melee.description: [latex]\emph{Special See text above.}[/latex]
melee.name: Whip

melee.description: A steel rod with a plasma blade at one end; damage listed for either end.
melee.name: Axe

melee.description: Your average knife. This would be a knife with a fairly large blade. Most sheath knives, kitchen knives, or hunting knives would fall into this category.
melee.name: Knife

melee.description: A standard European-style ``cut and thrust'' sword. It was the mainstay weapon of the footsoldiers of many past armies---a durable weapon that can be counted on in combat.
melee.name: Short Sword

melee.description: This is one of the simplest yet most effective polearms. An awl pike is a long, slender, metal spike affixed to the end of a long wooden pole. It is a highly effective stabbing weapon.
melee.name: Awl Pike

melee.description: A long wooden pole topped with an iron head. One side of the head features an axe blade; the other is equipped with a spike for piercing armor. Originally used as a tool for ships---the axe head was used to chop stuck mooring lines; the spike could be used to snag ropes or wreckage.
melee.name: Beaked Axe

melee.description: Where most polearms consist of a smallish blade with a long handle, the Bicento is a long blade with a long handle. The blade and handle would both measure somewhere around 4 feet in length.
melee.name: Bicento

melee.description: A lengthy handle topped with a hook-like metal blade. It can deliver fierce attacks, and can also be used to pull riders off their mounts.
melee.name: Glaive-Guisarme

melee.description: A simple, effective, weapon---especially for defensive positions. A halberd is basically a large knife blade mounted on a pole for extra reach.
melee.name: Halberd

melee.description: A vicious Japanese polearm equipped with a cross-like blade. Though not exceptionally damaging in and out of itself, it is unmatched when wielded by a powerful warrior.
melee.name: Katakamayari

melee.description: A long, reinforced wooden pole equipped with an iron point and handguard. It is generally used while riding on a charging horse. The faster you move, the more damage you can deal.
melee.name: Lance

melee.description: A larger spear used for hunting large animals, or for war. Generally around eight feet long.
melee.name: Long Spear

melee.description: Similar to a Beaked Axe. The head on a Lucerne hammer has one spiked face, and one crushing face.
melee.name: Lucerne Hammer

melee.description: A variant on a simple pike. The military fork is a group of thin metal tines (spikes) mounted to a long handle. It is much more effective for parrying than a pike, since one can catch weapons between its tines. It is also effective for hunting---it is excellent for spearing small animals or fish.
melee.name: Military Fork

melee.description: A Japanese halberd. The Naginata blade is actually much longer than its cutting edge, with the bulk of its length embedded in the handle. The superior blade and this unique construction make it a very deadly and well-balanced weapon.
melee.name: Naginata

melee.description: A very long sharp stick. Pikes are generally much longer than other polearms---often twenty feet long. The point is generally made from iron, but simple pikes might just have carved points.
melee.name: Pike

melee.description: Similar to a normal halberd, but equipped with a long, slender, blade.
melee.name: Sabre Halberd

melee.description: 20 AP
melee.name: Sankaku Yari

melee.description: This is cross-listed in the spears section. This would be a common hunting spear.
melee.name: Short Spear

melee.description: Originally a fisherman's tool, and a favored weapon of the gladiatorial area. A trident is a spear with three points, increasing the chances of striking a target.
melee.name: Trident

melee.description: A very large blade on a very long pole, dealing very high damage. Think of it like a halberd on steroids.
melee.name: Voulge

melee.description: A farming tool for cutting grain or brush. An unlikely weapon, but strangely effective.
melee.name: War Scythe

melee.description: A Japanese spear equipped with a forged and polished head. Though generally not very long, it has excellent damage potential. It can be thrown, but is designed to be used as a hand-held weapon, for stabbing and slashing. Since the blade is edged, it always deals S damage.
melee.name: Yari

melee.description: A different type of Japanese spear designed to penetrate armor. The point is narrow and rather small. It is triangular in profile (like a stiletto), forged from hard martensitic steel. It is capable of piercing the toughest armor.
melee.name: Yoroidoshi Yari

melee.description: A massive wooden hammer originally meant for driving posts into the earth. A warrior with enough strength to swing a great maul could easily drive his opponents six feet under.
melee.name: Great Maul

melee.description: A giant club that requires exceptional strength to wield. The weapon is roughly five feet long, with half of that length being the handle. The striking surface is covered in spikes fashioned from stone or iron.
melee.name: Hercules Club

melee.description: A fearsome weapon with a well-deserved reputation for combat effectiveness. This is a technologically superior mace, usually fashioned entirely from iron. The head is covered with strong spikes, enabling this weapon do deal significant damage.
melee.name: Morning Star

melee.description: A stout weapon used by the strongest of knights. A war hammer is an oversized sledgehammer, often sporting an iron-reinforced handle and spike-like striking faces. In the right hands, a warhammer is capable of smashing even the toughest armors.
melee.name: War Hammer

melee.description: An ingeniously designed weapon---a stout, backswept blade of considerable thickness counterbalanced with a tassel and weighted knot. When wielded by a strong warrior, a truly fearsome weapon.
melee.name: Chinese war sword

melee.description: Similar to a saber. A fairly heavy sword with a backswept blade that was the sidearm of many a high seas buccaneer.
melee.name: Cutlass

melee.description: Somwhat like a scimitar but with a straight blade. The back of the blade is straight, but the cutting edge is curved forward. The blade is very thick and gets wider near the tip---this concentrates the weight forward of the balance points of most swords. In the right hands, a very effective tool.
melee.name: Falchion

melee.description: The fearsome weapon of the Roman Legions. The Gladius is a heavy blade with an unusually sharp edge. It is good for stabbing and slashing. The Gladius is unusually durable.
melee.name: Gladius

melee.description: +1 to strike, -2 to parry
melee.name: Jambiya

melee.description: Delicate, cannot parry large weapons
melee.name: Kris

melee.description: A light sword with a backswept blade. A favored weapon of cavalries.
melee.name: Saber

melee.description: A heavy sword with a strongly curved blade. The excellent damage potential of this weapon made it favored with many Arab armies.
melee.name: Scimitar

melee.description: The class ``fencing'' sword used in duels from the [latex]$16^{th}$--$19^{th}$[/latex] c. If the user has weapon specialization in Small Sword then the weapon can be used as a P (Piercing) weapon for 2D6 with 4 AP and a MSB of 12. If the weapon is used as [latex]\emph{exotic}[/latex] (with the accompanying Exotic skill), then the wielder gets a bonus die to his pool when using the weapon with Multitarget.
melee.name: Small Sword
Stone Bat

melee.description: A Japanese short sword. It is usually carried in combination with a Katana (large sword), worn on the hip with the sharp side of the blade pointed upwards. The fantastic damage potential of this sword is due to the superior metallurgy of the blade---enabling it to achieve an exceptional level of sharpness.
melee.name: Wakizashi

melee.description: A large fighting staff, generally made from tough woods such as oak, mahogany, or ironwood. The Bo is roughly six feet in length and shaped to offer an exceptional grip and balance.
melee.name: Bo Staff

melee.description: A fighting staff forged entirely from iron or other metal. Weighing twenty pounds or more, it requires a good deal of strength to wield. However, it is practically indestructible and deals savage blows that are difficult to deflect.
melee.name: Full metal staff

melee.description: A wooden staff reinforced with iron end caps and studded bands throughout its length. The extra weight of the iron allows for devastating blows, and protects the wood from damage when parrying.
melee.name: Heavy Staff

melee.description: A true fighting staff. The Jo is roughly four feet long, and tapers from a thick center section to about 15mm in diameter at the ends. Though light and easy to swing, it can be an excellent weapon.
melee.name: Jo Staff

melee.description: A long wooden staff, such as a woodsman's hiking stick. Generally as long as the wielder is tall, the long staff can be a useful tool or an effective weapon.
melee.name: Long Staff

melee.description: A large fighting staff similar to the Bo. While the quarterstaff lacks the Bo's quality craftsmanship, it makes up for that by sheer mass. A quarterstaff is generally one foot taller than its wielder, and 30 or more mm thick.
melee.name: Quarterstaff

melee.description: A walking stick, cane, or similar wooden pole.
melee.name: Short Staff

melee.description: See Chakram (small)
melee.name: Chakram (large)

melee.description: A ring-shaped blade hurled at your target, much like a Frisbee. Chakrams are available in various sizes, ranging from six inches in diameter to over 16''. They are generally worn in groups on a belt hook, or slung on the warrior's arms.
melee.name: Chakram (small)

melee.description: A specially shaped spear designed to travel long distances. It is highly streamlined, and features a deadly point. Javelins are quite light, and easily carried. They were often used by foot soldiers before they came into melee combat range.
melee.name: Javelin

melee.description: as a throwing weapon (normally in Spear cat.)
melee.name: Short Spear

melee.description: The well known ``Ninja's star''. Shuriken are small starlike bladed throwing weapons, having anywhere from three to twelve points on them. The most common have between three and six points. They are very easy to conceal, but don't deal much damage. They are best used with skilled aim or with poisons. High quality shurikens are razor sharp and have superior damage capability.
melee.name: Shuriken, Common

melee.description: rare
melee.name: Shuriken, True

melee.description: A small axe balanced for hurling at your opponent. Surprisingly easy to use, and capable of dealing good damage. The throwing axe can also be used in hand-to-hand combat.
melee.name: Throwing Axe

melee.description: A knife specially designed for throwing. Throwing knives are usually double-sided, and have no handle covering. The handle is simply an unsharpened portion of the blade. They are made from unhardened steel so that they do not bounce or shatter on impact. If bent, they can be easily straightened.
melee.name: Throwing Knife

melee.description: A pencil sized steel dart with a tassel of some sort attached to the blunt end to ensure it flies straight. Especially effective with poisons. It has far better penetration capability than a knife or shuriken.
melee.name: Thrown Spike

miscellaneous.description: Millitary vest used to hold weapons, ammo, grenades, rations, tools, etc. for quick access.
miscellaneous.name: ALICE Rig

miscellaneous.description: A sturdy leather or nylon pouch that fits on your belt. Holds approx. 50 pistol rounds, 25 rifle rounds, or 15 shotgun shells
miscellaneous.name: Ammo Pouch, combo

miscellaneous.description: A leather or nylon pouch that fits on your belt. It holds up to four pistol magazines or two assault rifle mags
miscellaneous.name: Ammo Pouch, mag

miscellaneous.description: Add this to a set of goggles or glasses. It prevents flashes of light, etc, from stunning the wearer.
miscellaneous.name: Anti-dazzle lens

miscellaneous.description: A satchel with two straps designed to be worn on the back. A normal backpack can carry up to 40 lbs. Higher quality backpacks can hold up to 60 lbs. With a proper frame and waist strap, a backpack can carry up to 225 pounds, but has significant encumbrance (+1 Encumbrance for every 25 lbs above 75).
miscellaneous.name: Backpack

miscellaneous.description: Hiker's backpack with a metal frame. Carries up to 100 pounds of gear. Very comfortable.
miscellaneous.name: Backpack - hard

miscellaneous.description: A normal looking bag with an extradimensional space on the inside that holds extra weight and volume.
miscellaneous.name: Bag of Holding

miscellaneous.description: A piece of flat leather or other sturdy material with a hasp designed to keep a pair of pants on.
miscellaneous.name: Belt

miscellaneous.description: A large, flat plate designed to clasp a belt together. Typically comes with a design.
miscellaneous.name: Belt Buckle

miscellaneous.description: A belt made of brass, gold, and copper leaves; probably made by elves for trackers and hunters. Provides +1 to strike.
miscellaneous.name: Belt of Leaves

miscellaneous.description: A pair of binoculars that folds up for easy carrying. Magnifies 4 times.
miscellaneous.name: Binoculars, mini

miscellaneous.description: A normal pair of binoculars. Has a neck strap and a carrying case. Variable magnification from 5 to 10 times.
miscellaneous.name: Binoculars, standard

miscellaneous.description: A pair of high grade binoculars. Has a built in range finder and superior glass lenses. Mag varies from 5 to 20 times.
miscellaneous.name: Binoculars, super

miscellaneous.description: A beautiful blue ribbon.
miscellaneous.name: Blue Ribbon of Fagotry

miscellaneous.description: A backpack containing an inflatable boat, inflating device, and a set of collapsible paddles. Holds up to 750 lbs of people and gear. Not safe for ocean use, but not a toy.
miscellaneous.name: Boat, Portable

miscellaneous.description: A simple inflatable boat. Light duty. Will hold up to 500 lbs.
miscellaneous.name: Boat, inflatable

miscellaneous.description: Very high quality portable/inflatable boat. Kit weighs 160 lbs, carried in two packs. Has boat (seats four adults+250 lbs of gear), inflator, repair kit, portable paddes, and a small gas engine. Boat is very durable and will withstand small-caliber gunshots.
miscellaneous.name: Boat, portable Zodiac

miscellaneous.description: Any sort of book.
miscellaneous.name: Book

miscellaneous.description: Made for walking.
miscellaneous.name: Boots

miscellaneous.description: A dish for serving things which are prone to escape.
miscellaneous.name: Bowl

miscellaneous.description: Similar to a SCUBA tank. Has a mask and tank that protects the wearer from gases, diseases, fumes, etc, even in enviornments that have no oxygen. Worn by firefighters, etc. Tank is good for 3 hours, can be refilled.
miscellaneous.name: Breathing Apparatus

miscellaneous.description: Listening device the size of a button. Transmits what it hears to a common AM/FM radio. Range is 1000' max.
miscellaneous.name: Bug, micro

miscellaneous.description: Listening device attached to a telephone. Range is 1 mile.
miscellaneous.name: Bug, phone tap

miscellaneous.description: Listening device. Button sized, has special encrypted transmssions. Range is 1 mile.
miscellaneous.name: Bug, super

miscellaneous.description: A lantern with an enclosure that is either mirrored or highly-polished metal on the interior with a single exit hole. A Bull's Eye lantern produces a long beam (about 100 feet long) for normal burn time (see the Lantern), but only in a directed fashion. Some forms of the Bull's Eye Lantern have multiple shutters. Some have fresnel lenses (although this can increase the cost of the lantern by a factor of 10 or a 100). The lense increases the distance of the lantern to 250 feet.
miscellaneous.name: Bull's Eye Lantern

miscellaneous.description: Used for dressing animals in the field. Contains meat bags, skinning knife, saw, and a compact game hoist.
miscellaneous.name: Butcher's kit

miscellaneous.description: Digital video camera. Not a true pro-grade camera, but can store hundreds of photos and you don't have film hassles.
miscellaneous.name: Camera, Digital

miscellaneous.description: Video camera that records to tape or data discs. It is NOT broadcast quality, but is compact and easy to carry.
miscellaneous.name: Camera, Video

miscellaneous.description: Zoom lens for a camera for long-distance shots
miscellaneous.name: Camera, Zoom Lens

miscellaneous.description: A simple film camera.
miscellaneous.name: Camera, basic

miscellaneous.description: A pro grade film camera. Includes some different lenses, filters, etc.
miscellaneous.name: Camera, professional

miscellaneous.description: Super-small camera that can be easily concealed. Can be used like a normal camera, or can be set like a booby trap.
miscellaneous.name: Camera, spy

miscellaneous.description: A two-wheeled cart with attachments for a single pulling animal.
miscellaneous.name: Cart, 2-wheeled

miscellaneous.description: A four-wheel cart for use with a single draft-animal.
miscellaneous.name: Cart, 4-wheel

miscellaneous.description: A 2-wheeled cart for an Ox, has a much deeper bed and much taller sides.
miscellaneous.name: Cart, Ox

miscellaneous.description: Kingdom
miscellaneous.name: Cat

miscellaneous.description: A chemical light stick. Bend it to activate. This is a special stick that only lasts 20-30 minuites at most. It is VERY bright, like a good flashlight. Excellent for signaling, etc.
miscellaneous.name: Chemlight, bright

miscellaneous.description: A small chemical light stick. It's about the size of a hair pin. Makes a great fishing lure
miscellaneous.name: Chemlight, mini

miscellaneous.description: A chemical light stick. Bend it to activiate. Works in any temperature, no batteries, etc. Gives off enough light to perform simple tasks in complete darkness. Lasts for 8-10 hours.
miscellaneous.name: Chemlight, stick

miscellaneous.description: Climibing shoes, gear belt / harness, climbing axe, pitons, etc.
miscellaneous.name: Climbing Gear

miscellaneous.description: As above, but includes ice axe, crampons (spiked shoes), ice screws, etc.
miscellaneous.name: Climbing Gear - Ice

miscellaneous.description: Keeps ya' covered.
miscellaneous.name: Clothes

miscellaneous.description: Waterproof coat. Good for travelling, etc.
miscellaneous.name: Coat, Raincoat

miscellaneous.description: Keeps you warm, dry, and is great for concealing things. Can conceal a shotgun or rifle.
miscellaneous.name: Coat, Trenchcoat

miscellaneous.description: Keeps your extra magazines, grenades, pistol, etc, close at hand and ready for use
miscellaneous.name: Combat Belt

miscellaneous.description: A small calculator-sized mini computer. Used for storing notes, directions, can also save small files, etc.
miscellaneous.name: Computer, PDA

miscellaneous.description: High powered computer, "cutting edge" of the era
miscellaneous.name: Computer, advanced

miscellaneous.description: A simple computer with monitor, etc.
miscellaneous.name: Computer, basic

miscellaneous.description: Portable version of a normal computer. Runs off of batteries or can be plugged in.
miscellaneous.name: Computer, portable

miscellaneous.description: This was made by a Cordelian weaponsmith as a gift of a high-ranking military comander whose daughter the smith was courting. The accompanying armor was long ago destroyed, but the belt has survived. A dark brown iron studded leather belt with an iron buckle; shaped like a weight-lifters belt. Archaic Weapons at plus one level. -1 to all Charisma and Intelligence based skills. Healing magic has half effect.
miscellaneous.name: Cordelian Belt of the Warrior

miscellaneous.description: Midcalf heavy leather boots with a short heel and typically pointed shoe. Designed to ease horse-riding with stirrups.
miscellaneous.name: Cowboy Boots

miscellaneous.description: A type of hat normally worn by workers who deal with cattle in the open desert or other arid climates.
miscellaneous.name: Cowboy Hat

miscellaneous.description: Supplies for performing first aid on cyborgs, etc. Contains many of the same things as a normal first aid kit, but also specialized drugs, and extra supplies.
miscellaneous.name: Cyber-medicine kit

miscellaneous.description: Extra tank gives up to 2 hour dive time.
miscellaneous.name: Diving - Extra tank

miscellaneous.description: SCUBA kit with tank, regulator, weight belt, BCD vest. Everything needed for 1 person. 1 hour maximum dive time.
miscellaneous.name: Diving Kit

miscellaneous.description: Domain
miscellaneous.name: Dog

miscellaneous.description: Kingdom
miscellaneous.name: Donkey

miscellaneous.description: A heavy, denim bag in the shape of a tube with a single, heavy strap. Can easily accomodate 75 lbs. Larger versions can go up to 250 lbs. For every 25 lbs. a duffel bag adds 1 encumbrance.
miscellaneous.name: Duffel Bag

miscellaneous.description: A large, four-kneed animal weighing around 16000 lbs. Elephants are the biggest of the domesticated draft animals. Carts and wagons must be specially designed to be used with them.
miscellaneous.name: Elephant

miscellaneous.description: An Elephant of War can weigh up to 26000 lbs and be 16 or 17 feet tall. This is the only type of elephant that can be controlled in combat.
miscellaneous.name: Elephant of War

miscellaneous.description: A comforter, filled with feathers.
miscellaneous.name: Feather Comforter

miscellaneous.description: A nice feather mattress; bulky but only about 25 lbs.
miscellaneous.name: Feather Mattress

miscellaneous.description: A small box containing a multi-piece rod & reel, line, hooks, lures, and a small folding net.
miscellaneous.name: Fishing Kit, portable

miscellaneous.description: A heavy shirt made of flannel with (pearl) snap buttons, with a collar.
miscellaneous.name: Flannel Shirt

miscellaneous.description: These flares look like shotgun shells. They are fired from a launcher and ignite high in the air, whereafter they drift slowly back down. Available in red, green, blue, yellow, white. Priced per set of 5.
miscellaneous.name: Flares, aerial

miscellaneous.description: Looks like pistol. Fires aerial signal flares
miscellaneous.name: Flares, launcher

miscellaneous.description: A stick-type flare that burns with a bright red flame. (Road flare). For marking targets, warnings, etc. Good for starting fires too.
miscellaneous.name: Flares, signal

miscellaneous.description: Metal police flashlight. Can be used as a club. Very tough, waterproof, high brightness
miscellaneous.name: Flashlight, Heavy duty

miscellaneous.description: Portable spotlight for hunting, search-and-rescue, etc. Runs for 4 hours, VERY powerful.
miscellaneous.name: Flashlight, Spotlight

miscellaneous.description: Pen-sized pocket flashlight
miscellaneous.name: Flashlight, pen light

miscellaneous.description: A handy flashlight that fits in your pocket.
miscellaneous.name: Flashlight, small

miscellaneous.description: A normal flashlight. It takes two D-size batteries.
miscellaneous.name: Flashlight, standard

miscellaneous.description: Flint, Striker, a small, sealed, wooden box, and tender (typically moss). Can be used to start a fire, although this can take 15 or 20 minutes or more.
miscellaneous.name: Flint and Tender

miscellaneous.description: Comes in two forms depending upon the time period. Pre-modern folding charis are a triangle of leather suspended between three stout posts. A modern (or ultramodern) chair forms a full chair with armrests and a back.
miscellaneous.name: Folding Chair

miscellaneous.description: Magnifying glass, fingerprinting supplies, disposable camera, evidence bags, composite sketch kit, notebook, handbook
miscellaneous.name: Forensics kit

miscellaneous.description: Global Positioning System tool. About the size of a calculator. Has advanced 2-D and 3-D mapping information, weather data, can store and re-display paths travelled, etc. Can display directions in urban areas.
miscellaneous.name: GPS Rec. superior

miscellaneous.description: Global Positioning System tool. About the size of a calculator, it tells you exactly where you are in the world. Has limited mapping functions too.
miscellaneous.name: GPS Reciever

miscellaneous.description: rubber mask with filter prevents poisous gases, smoke, etc, from harming the wearer. Filter is good for 6 hours.
miscellaneous.name: Gas Mask

miscellaneous.description: extra filter for gas mask. Lasts for 6 hours.
miscellaneous.name: Gas Mask filter

miscellaneous.description: Any sort of gem.
miscellaneous.name: Gem

miscellaneous.description: A big generator that might be found on a construction site. Can run power tools, big floodlights, etc.
miscellaneous.name: Generator, large

miscellaneous.description: A backpack sized portable generator. Good for operating small electronic devices like TV, radio, etc.
miscellaneous.name: Generator, small

miscellaneous.description: Glass bottles vary in cost dependent upon size, cost, quality, and timeperiod. For the modern period, a glass bottle is typically about 5 dollars per liter (non-bulk). In "medieval" periods they would be about 50 dollars per liter. In for "ancient" time periods or very-out-of-the-way, they are about 500 dollars (or more) per liter.
miscellaneous.name: Glass Bottle

miscellaneous.description: Heavy-duty gloves made from kevlar or metal that prevents your hand from being cut when handling sharp objects. Has 1/4/0 Armor for the hands.
miscellaneous.name: Gloves, Butcher's

miscellaneous.description: Specially treated gloves to improve your grip on objects. Gives +1 STR when in a strength contest, etc.
miscellaneous.name: Gloves, Grip

miscellaneous.description: Gloves for cold weather. -3 Dex while wearing them
miscellaneous.name: Gloves, Mittens

miscellaneous.description: Leather gloves to protect the hands from minor cuts and abrasions while working
miscellaneous.name: Gloves, Work

miscellaneous.description: Full wraparound goggles that protect the eyes from dust, shrapnel, chemicals, and laser sighting devices
miscellaneous.name: Goggles - combat

miscellaneous.description: Provides monochrome night vision by amplfiying ambient light
miscellaneous.name: Goggles - night vision

miscellaneous.description: Allows wearer to "see" heat. It has a limited ability to see heat through things. The thicker the cover, the less detail.
miscellaneous.name: Goggles - thermal

miscellaneous.description: Police quality handcuffs. Cannot be broken unless STR >19, Lock can be picked at -4 to roll.
miscellaneous.name: Handcuffs

miscellaneous.description: Extra-high security handcuffs. Requires STR > 26 to break them. Lock is -10 to pick.
miscellaneous.name: Handcuffs, super

miscellaneous.description: A small square piece of cloth.
miscellaneous.name: Handkerchief

miscellaneous.description: For head.
miscellaneous.name: Hat

miscellaneous.description: Keep the sun and the bugs off your head.
miscellaneous.name: Hat, Adventurer's

miscellaneous.description: For 1 foot. Weighs .2 lbs.
miscellaneous.name: Hemp Rope

miscellaneous.description: A simple holster that holds your gun at your hip. Can be modern appearance, or "old west" type.
miscellaneous.name: Holster, Hip

miscellaneous.description: Holds a pistol or SMG on your leg. Can't be concealed, but offers +2 to quick draw the weapon.
miscellaneous.name: Holster, SWAT

miscellaneous.description: Quality leather rig holds your pistol by your shoulder or armpit. Conceals under a jacket easily. Fit to the wearer
miscellaneous.name: Holster, Shoulder

miscellaneous.description: Used to conceal a gun inside your pants or by your bellybutton.
miscellaneous.name: Holster, concealed

miscellaneous.description: A horse that has been only been trained to draft; that is be hitched to pull a plow, wagon, cart, ferry, etc. These horses can weigh up to 1500 lbs. (making them about the size of the largest Warhorse). They can stand up to 16 hands at the withers.
miscellaneous.name: Horse, Draft

miscellaneous.description: A normal farm horse (Quarter).
miscellaneous.name: Horse, Farm

miscellaneous.description: A horse that has been trained to be ridden. Not combat ready.
miscellaneous.name: Horse, Riding

miscellaneous.description: A shire horse is the largest of the Draft horses. They can be 18 or 20 hands high and over a ton, and some specimens (although very rare) have come in at 24 hands and 3000+ lbs. These horses, even given their size, are unusually strong, and have unusual endurance. They are known for their kindness, but also for their great stupidity. They are unusable as Warhorses, although attempts (unsuccessful) have been made.
miscellaneous.name: Horse, Shire

miscellaneous.description: Also called a Postal Horse. These are the fastest horses money can buy; they have been bred for unusually long endurance, which means Thoroughbreds are not only the fastest but also the longest distance horses. It is not unusual for a Thoroughbred to be able to maintain speeds of 40+ mph for 6 or more hours.
miscellaneous.name: Horse, Thoroughbred

miscellaneous.description: A heavy, denim jacket. Normally with heavy brass flat-tack buttons and pockets.
miscellaneous.name: Jean's Jacket

miscellaneous.description: A pair of pants made from heavy denim, normally triple-stitched for extra strength. Typically comes with front and back pockets and loops for a belt.
miscellaneous.name: Jeans

miscellaneous.description: A metal or plastic container for storing & transporting gas, water, oil, etc. Very rugged. Has a 5 gallon capacity, and can be used with most chemicals.
miscellaneous.name: Jerry Can

miscellaneous.description: Gas or oil. A lantern is a bulkier but more efficient way to light an area as it typically comes with a glass enclosure and a flue to increase the temperature of burning. A lantern burns one ounce of oil per hour to light a 20 foot radius. Burning four times as much oil per hour double the equvalent lit area.
miscellaneous.name: Lantern

miscellaneous.description: A nifty little tool that will open nearly all simple key locks in a second or two. Can be used by unskilled persons. Tool gives Lockpick: 2 regardless of level of user. Only works on simple locks (no good for cars, safes, combinations, etc.)
miscellaneous.name: Lock Picks, gun

miscellaneous.description: A full lockpick set, about the size of a hardcover book. Contains many different types of picks and specialty tools. Use for car locks, padlocks, doors, etc. +3 to lockpick skill.
miscellaneous.name: Lock Picks, master

miscellaneous.description: A small leather pouch containing a tension wrench and 3-4 commonly shaped picks. Good for simple locks.
miscellaneous.name: Lock Picks, mini

miscellaneous.description: A pouch about the size of a glasses case. It contains a tension wrench, and an assortment of picks and other lock tools. This would be sufficient for most locks.
miscellaneous.name: Lock Picks, set

miscellaneous.description: A small tote bag with a good selection of first aid supplies. Gauze banadges, antiseptic, scissors, simple drugs, elastic bandage, etc.
miscellaneous.name: Medical Kit

miscellaneous.description: A small waterproof box with basic first aid supplies (band aids, gauze bandages, ointment, aspirin, etc.)
miscellaneous.name: Medical Kit - First Aid

miscellaneous.description: A large duffel bag crammed with most of an emergency room. Enough to complete simple many surgical procedures. A full assortment of bandages, many drugs (painkillers, disease treatments, anesthetic, antibiotics, etc), surgical tools, splints, portable EKG machine, emergency fluids & blood supply, sutures, etc.
miscellaneous.name: Medical Kit - Large

miscellaneous.description: Frying pan x2, pan lid, cup, bowl, knife, fork, spoon, and salt/pepper shaker. It all nests together in a small pouch.
miscellaneous.name: Mess Kit

miscellaneous.description: Portable telephone. Works off of cellular system. Works in all major cities and most suburbs.
miscellaneous.name: Mobile Phone

miscellaneous.description: Portable telephone. Works off of satellites. Works anywhere on earth.
miscellaneous.name: Mobile Phone, sat

miscellaneous.description: 5x the cost of gold.
miscellaneous.name: Money

miscellaneous.description: Come in various sizes (ounces of fluid). An oil lamp burns about one ounce of oil per hour to light a 10-foot-radius zone. Burning the oil four times as fast doubles the equivalent site radius. Oil lamps can be made of many materials such as stone, fired clay, glass, brass, bronze, or steel.
miscellaneous.name: Oil Lamp

miscellaneous.description: An Oliphant is a semimagical breed of Titanic War Elephant. They are typically about 40' feet tall and weigh around 55 tons. They are adorned with tusks, uptusks (like a warthog), sabre-fangs, and incisorial glancing-tusks (upward bending tusks like a walrus).
miscellaneous.name: Oliphant

miscellaneous.description: Lasts approximately 2 hours in a well-ventilated room. Gives off a prodigious amount of smoke, but smells pretty good.
miscellaneous.name: Pine Tar Torch

miscellaneous.description: Pitch torches are "better" than pine-tar torches because they produce a less perfidious odor. They also lasts about 6 hours.
miscellaneous.name: Pitch Torch

miscellaneous.description: A small bag, usually with a drawstring. Can hold only a couple of pounds of items.
miscellaneous.name: Pouch

miscellaneous.description: Any precious metal.
miscellaneous.name: Precious Metal

miscellaneous.description: Any precious stone (not a gem!)
miscellaneous.name: Precious Stone

miscellaneous.description: A radio headset that has hands-free operation. Works up to 2 miles away in clear areas. Each
miscellaneous.name: Radio, Comm headset

miscellaneous.description: A hand-held radio that lets you talk to other people with similar radios. Has a range up to 2 miles in clear areas. Each.
miscellaneous.name: Radio, Walkie-Talkie

miscellaneous.description: Millitary ration (MRE) or equivalent. A plastic bag containing a full meal. About as big as a "bag lunch"
miscellaneous.name: Rations

miscellaneous.description: A small food bar. Highly nutritious (1 day's food in one bar!), but tastes awful. Same size as a candy bar.
miscellaneous.name: Rations - mini

miscellaneous.description: For repairing robotics, power armor, and mecha. Contains specialized tools (but not basics, which are also needed) Oil, wire, common replacement parts, special repair materials, etc.
miscellaneous.name: Repair Kit

miscellaneous.description: Any sort of ring.
miscellaneous.name: Ring

miscellaneous.description: A ring with the Daylight Globe spell cast on it. This normally has either fixed charges or charges-per-day.
miscellaneous.name: Ring of Daylight Globe

miscellaneous.description: Crafted by Darin Tealpeck who wore it whenever he left his castle. A large man's ring mad eof a gold-bearing alloy. Roughly made, with a head of a ram on it. Tarnished.
miscellaneous.name: Ring of the Ram

miscellaneous.description: Woven rope handles better and is safer for climbing than normal rope. Can hold up to 1000 lbs. 100 feet
miscellaneous.name: Rope, climbing

miscellaneous.description: Basic twisted rope. Good for all sorts of uses! Can hold up to 500 lbs before it breaks. Price is for 100 feet
miscellaneous.name: Rope, utility

miscellaneous.description: Using a move equivalent action, turn on Satan's Stopwatch. For this turn and the next, gain an extra standard action. The Stopwatch is truly indestructible; when using the watch, the user's aura is modified to reflect Satan's power.
miscellaneous.name: Satan's Stopwatch

miscellaneous.description: Any sort.
miscellaneous.name: Semiprecious Stone

miscellaneous.description: Crafted approximately one hundred years ago by a seafaring people of unknown origin. A pair of gray leather gloves that cover all five fingers and end at the wrist. A set of woven silk laces on the back of the hand allow the gloves to be secured tightly to the hand. The leather is made from the preserved hide of a giant shark
miscellaneous.name: Sharkskin Gloves

miscellaneous.description: For digging holes. A regular shovel with a wooden handle
miscellaneous.name: Shovel

miscellaneous.description: Portable army shovel. It folds up to take less space.
miscellaneous.name: Shovel, folding

miscellaneous.description: For one foot. Weights 2 ounces.
miscellaneous.name: Silk Rope

miscellaneous.description: A heavy, flat, iron pan. Skillets come in all sizes. Superior versions have very thick cast-iron bottoms.
miscellaneous.name: Skillet

miscellaneous.description: A flat, heavy bag designed to be slept in. Can be made of light leather, denim, or cotton with a stuffing (the best use arctic feathers). A sleeping bag can accommodate one person comfortably or two as a tight fit. Superior versions are no heavier or bulkier but can enable surviving cooler tempatures. A normal sleeping backpack is good down to freezing. Additional superiority can reduce the minimum tempurature in steps of 40 degrees.
miscellaneous.name: Sleeping Bag

miscellaneous.description: For walking on snow. Also useful for loose desert sand
miscellaneous.name: Snowshoes

miscellaneous.description: Wool or cotten tube designed to be worn on the foot.
miscellaneous.name: Socks

miscellaneous.description: This is for 1 feet of rope. Weighs 1--2 ounce.
miscellaneous.name: Spidersilk Rope

miscellaneous.description: Any sort of statue.
miscellaneous.name: Statue

miscellaneous.description: Used for diving in very cold water.
miscellaneous.name: Suit- Dry suit

miscellaneous.description: Special rubber and plastic suit covers the entire body. Has a built-in gas mask. Prevents harm due to posion gas, smoke, dangerous chemicals, spills, fumes, toxins, diseases, etc.
miscellaneous.name: Suit- Enviornmental

miscellaneous.description: NOMEX clothing and helmet. Has no armor value, but protects wearer from fire.
miscellaneous.name: Suit- Fire

miscellaneous.description: Sniper's camo suit. Must be purchased for a certain type of terrain (desert, woodland, urban, etc...) Gives +4 to camo skill.
miscellaneous.name: Suit- Ghillie

miscellaneous.description: Space suit, similar to that worn by astrounauts. Has an emergency air supply built in.
miscellaneous.name: Suit- Space

miscellaneous.description: Used for diving. Keeps wearer protected from abrasions, jellyfish, etc. Keeps diver warm.
miscellaneous.name: Suit- Wetsuit

miscellaneous.description: A fanny pack containing simple first aid supplies, two days of emergency rations, poncho, fishing supplies, knife, snare, matches, 100 feet of strong cord, signal mirror, magnifying lens, water purifying tablets, and basic medications.
miscellaneous.name: Survival Kit, basic

miscellaneous.description: A backpack with enough gear to survive for a long time: first aid supplies, 15 days of mini-rations, knife, fishing supplies, snare, guidebook to animals & plants, 4 days of water, water filter, compass, flashlight, signal equipment, flare launcher, matches, assorted drugs, compact sleeping blanket, battery powered radio, and a .22 caliber gun with 200 rounds.
miscellaneous.name: Survival Kit, full

miscellaneous.description: A type of shirt made from cotton or a cotton-polyblend with short or long sleeves; no collar and simplified construction.
miscellaneous.name: T-shirt

miscellaneous.description: A small stone pendant carved with a Yin--Yang. The size of a quarter of black-granite. Part is inlaid with mother-of-pearl. The back is engraved with eight Tao hexagrams in an octagonal pattern inlaid in gold. There is a crude fiber cord attached to the pendant.
miscellaneous.name: Tao Tieh Pendant

miscellaneous.description: High quality tent will stand up to the worst weather conditions. Fits 3 adults max.
miscellaneous.name: Tent, expedition

miscellaneous.description: A big ``cabin'' style tent. Has lots of room inside, up to 8 adults.
miscellaneous.name: Tent, large

miscellaneous.description: A small tent. Will fit two adults max.
miscellaneous.name: Tent, small

miscellaneous.description: A tiny tent large enough for one person. Fits into a pants pocket!
miscellaneous.name: Tent, survival

miscellaneous.description: Large tool kit for working on machinery, vehicles, or mecha. Fits in a large rolling chest or small trailer. Has many special tools such as a large jack, extra-large wrench set for big jobs, portable engine hoist, small air compressor, metal and wood cutting saws, powered wrench, gas torch, etc.
miscellaneous.name: Tool kit- advanced

miscellaneous.description: A portable pouch with the basics: Hammer, screwdrivers, adjustable wrench, pliers, measuring tape, and a small saw
miscellaneous.name: Tool kit- basic

miscellaneous.description: A big tool box filled with a large assortment of tools. Weighs about 70 lbs. Good for most basic jobs.
miscellaneous.name: Tool kit- standard

miscellaneous.description: Firefighter's tool. A single piece of metal that has a hammer, axe, hydrant wrench, and a special prying edge. It can be used to force open doors, etc.
miscellaneous.name: Tool, Halligan

miscellaneous.description: A pocket tool similar to a ``swiss army knife''. It has common tools inside, like pliers, screwdriver, knife blade, etc. Very handy, but not tough enough for serious jobs or manuverable enough for delicate work.
miscellaneous.name: Tool, MultiTool

miscellaneous.description: 2-in-1 tool. Used to break car windshields and cut seatbelts/clothing. Cannot be used as a weapon.
miscellaneous.name: Tool, Rescue

miscellaneous.description: Any eating utensil such as a spoon, fork, knife or chopstick.
miscellaneous.name: Utensil

miscellaneous.description: A large four-wheeled cart, possibly enclosed. Can accomodate one or two draft animals.
miscellaneous.name: Wagon

miscellaneous.description: A very large wagon that can accomodate a team of Oxen, like a regular wagon, but much larger.
miscellaneous.name: Wagon, Ox

miscellaneous.description: A wagon with a light-weight steel undercarriage with wicker-work and canvas top. The top is oiled and made from doubled-egypt cloth and is therefore weather proof. A Postal Carrier weighs approximately 1--4 of an equivalently sized wagon, but uses the same number of draft animals. It can maintain twice the speed of a normal wagon.
miscellaneous.name: Wagon, Postal Carrier

miscellaneous.description: A wagon which can accomodate a team of draft animals. Teams come in even numbers; for example, this type of wagon can accomodate teams of 2,4,6, or 8 draft animals.
miscellaneous.name: Wagon, Team

miscellaneous.description: A "normal" warhorse is much larger than a regular horse, being around 1300 lbs. Only warhorses can be used in combat.
miscellaneous.name: Warhorse

miscellaneous.description: These are the largest of the Warhorses, weighing in at 1500 or more pounds. They are known for extreme (and violent) attachment to a single rider and will literally attempt to kill any others attempting to ride them. Furies are the strongest, fastest, and most durable of all the Warhorses.
miscellaneous.name: Warhorse, Furious

miscellaneous.description: A breed of Warhorse used by mounted and heavily armored soldiers. These Warhorses are not much bigger than a normal Warhorse, but are much stronger. They are typically slower but have greater endurance. Only warhorses can be used in combat.
miscellaneous.name: Warhorse, Heavy

miscellaneous.description: A subbreed of the Furious, the King's Own is a slightly lighter, but much faster horse than the Furious. They are trained to be able to handle two riders. Only warhorses can be used in combat.
miscellaneous.name: Warhorse, King's Own

miscellaneous.description: A smaller horse bred for speed and ferocity. Only warhorses can be used in combat.
miscellaneous.name: Warhorse, Light

miscellaneous.description: A wristwatch with a built-in calculator.
miscellaneous.name: Watch, Calculator

miscellaneous.description: Tells the time. That's about it.
miscellaneous.name: Watch, standard

miscellaneous.description: A heavy-duty watch that's nearly indestructible. Waterproof, has built in compass, thermometer, and other features.
miscellaneous.name: Watch, survival

ranged.description: A hollow tube, fashioned from wood or metal, which is used to shoot small darts by means of blowing into one end. Blowguns deal very low damage intrinsically, but are very effective for delivering poisons to the target. Many primitive tribes rely on the silent attack of the blowgun to hunt animals for food.
ranged.name: Blow Gun - Long

ranged.description: A simple tool used for capturing animals. The bolo is a bundle of long cords tied together in a common knot. The free ends of the cords are tipped with weights. The bolo is whirled around the head and then thrown---upon striking, the cords are likely to entangle the target's legs. Though not thought of as a common weapon of war, bolos have been used in combat, and can be very useful.
ranged.name: Bolo

ranged.description: A composite bow is one that is made from multiple layers of wood that are glued together. It also has a semi-recurve design. This creates a bow that is significantly more durable and more powerful than a smaller bow. They are about 4..5 feet long.
ranged.name: Composite Bow

ranged.description: A modern variation of the archaic bow. The compound bow has a pulley system attached to the string, which provides increased velocity. They generally have a very high draw weight, but are designed so that once they are pulled back, the weight the shooter has to hold while aiming is far less than the actual power of the bow. Though some archaic bows are more powerful, the compound bow is much more durable and more compact.
ranged.name: Compound Bow

ranged.description: A bow made from iron equipped with a gun-like trigger assembly for firing. Crossbows range in size from the small pistol-sized ones through larger ones used for hunting and war, through the largest sizes, which are so powerful they require a mechanical crank to cock them. Crossbows always require one action or more to load. Modern crossbows are made from composite materials, and even the larger sizes are fairly light and easily carried.
ranged.name: Crossbow - Heavy

ranged.description: Always deals P damage. Bullets are $1 each
ranged.name: Crossbow - Pellet, hand

ranged.description: Always deals P damage. Bullets are $1 each
ranged.name: Crossbow - Pellet, large

ranged.description: takes 2 hands to reload, but 1 to fire.
ranged.name: Crossbow - Repeating

ranged.description: A variant of the short bow optimized for hunting. It is of similar size, but is made of more flexible wood and has a larger draw length. It is designed so that it is powerful, but isn't too large to carry while stalking game. This bow can kill larger deer, antelope, etc.
ranged.name: Hunters Bow

ranged.description: A much heavier bow developed by the English. A true Long bow is made from Yew wood, and is at least six feet long. When equipped with the proper arrows, it can penetrate full plate armor.
ranged.name: Long Bow

ranged.description: A recurve bow is one that has been specially treated so that the bow itself ``wants'' to bend in the opposite direction that it actually does when drawn. This puts more force on the bowstring therefore equates to a more powerful bow.
ranged.name: Recurve Bow

ranged.description: A common bow used for hunting, target shooting, or combat. The short bow is generally four feet long. It can be used to hunt animals weighing less than a man.
ranged.name: Short Bow

ranged.description: The weapon used by David to slay Goliath. A sling is a simple leather or cloth strip with a pocket in the center. The pocket is loaded with a stone, or other object, and the sling is whirled about the head and released, sending the stone flying at high speed. Slings deal decent damage, and are very simple to create. They are often used to harass enemy troops, or to launch various nasty substances into enemy ranks.
ranged.name: Sling

ranged.description: A very simple modern weapon. The slingshot is a Y-shaped frame, often made from wood, into which a thick rubber band has been mounted. The slingshot is held in one hand, while the other hand loads the band with your choice of missile, and stretches it back, then firing. Slingshots are so simple children often make them. Professionally made slingshots, which fire metal balls, can be quite powerful, and can kill in the proper hands. They are effective for hunting small game.
ranged.name: Slingshot

spell.description:
This spell fires a thin beam of compressed gas and wind from the caster's outstretched hand. The beam is very hard to see becasue it looks like a hazy distortion in the air--it is very nearly transparent. The beam may be fired at any target within 100 feet range.
Air Laser has AP: 50 and is at a +3 to strike.
Note: this spell is not actually a laser in the true sense of the word, thus it is not affected by typical laser defenses.
spell.name: Air Laser

spell.description:
The caster enchants a bit of air surrounding one target, forming it into an invisible cutting blade. The blade automatically strikes the target.
This spell is only effective if the intended target is surrounded by air. It is ineffective in an air-free enviornment, such as in space or underwater.
spell.name: Air Scythe

spell.description:
The caster charges a ball of electricity between his hands and then throws it forward in a direction of his choosing. The ball travels in a straight line from the caster towards its intended target. The ball can travel no more than 150 feet away, or to the intended target, whichever is closer.
The ball explodes into a flash of lightning and sparks whenever it strikes its intended target or reaches its maximum range in the event of a miss. This deals 1D10 x5 U damage to the target and anything occupying the target square. This spell does not have the Fire effect though it will ignite readily flammible materials in the target square.
Furthermore, any creature that is within 10 feet of the path the ball travels (except the caster) is struck by a small lightning bolt dealiong 1D10 x2 damage. (roll this damage seperatley for each target harmed in this manner) The final target does not suffer this damage in addition to the normal target damage.
The caster may throw the ball through hard objects or through "friendly" targets by making the ball disappear and reappear along its path. The ball can pass though inaninmate objects or open areas 15' or less in size and then reappear without stopping it or diminishing it's effect on the target if the caster makes a magical control check for each object or space he wishes the ball to skip.
spell.name: Ball lightning

spell.description:
Caster calls down a single lighting bolt from the sky, which strikes the target. It has a 50% chance of fire effect.
This spell is only effective outdoors.
If this spell is cast on a stormy day, it deals double damage and the caster gets +3 to his strike roll.
spell.name: Call Lightning

spell.description: The caster fires a bolt of lightning from his outstretched arms. The bolt automatically strikes one target, dealing 1D10 x 5 damage. The bolt then immedietly jumps to another target within 40 feet of the first, dealing 4x 1D10, etc. The bolt keeps jumping, each time losing 1x damage. The bolt jumps four times for a total of five different strikes. Chain Lightning can jump to the same target more than once, as long as the target wasn't the target of the previous strike. Each lightning jump always strikes the closest possible target from its previous jump, unless the caster makes a Magical Control check to redirect it elsewhere at -1 for each 5 feet between the closest target and the caster's preferred target.
spell.name: Chain Lightning

spell.description:
The caster conjures up a field of intense lightning energy, fire, and sparks which fills one 5-foot square (which must be a valid target) and four surrounding squares (a cross shape).
Anything in the area of effect of the spell suffers 2D10x5 U per turn for the duration of the spell. Also, on each of the caster's turns one randomly determined target within 20' of the area of effect is struck by a lightning bolt dealing 3D10 U.
spell.name: Corona

spell.description:
Generates a large cloud of dense black-gray smoke filling 50,000 cubic feet. (50x50x20), which then dissipates naturally.
This smoke is not hazardous or unpleasant to breathe, though it does obscure vision.
spell.name: Create Smoke

spell.description:
Deflection enchants one target with a field of anti-gravity. This has the following effects on the target:
+3 levels to dodge skill (and similar skills based on dodge) +3 to any DEX or skill rolls related to jumping or avoiding objects. +2 levels to parry +2 levels to block (shield skill) -6 to strike with melee attacks -3 to other types of DEX checks or skills involving manual dexterity or manipulation of small objects.
spell.name: Deflection

spell.description:
Caster forms a small bolt of lighting in his/her hands and sends it flying towards any one target.
(has a 50% chance of fire effect)
spell.name: Electric Bolt

spell.description: Caster manipulates air molecules to create an electrostatic discharge wherever he chooses. It doesn't have fire effect, but it can ignite very flammable materials such as gasoline, lamp oil, dry tinder, natural gas, etc. Target must be within 20' of caster. Caster can use touch to strike with the spell automatically.
spell.name: Electrospark

spell.description: Generates an area of highly charged air. Electronic devices in the field such as appliances, cellular phones, computers, or walkie-talkies have 60% chance to fail in operation. Furthermore, static electricity in the area will move about lightweight objects and fine particles are likely to become stuck to anything moving in the area.
spell.name: Energy Field

spell.description: A powerful spell that forces the air immediately surrounding one target to undergo immediate and complete mass-energy transformation, creating a powerful explosion with the target inside it. X is the size of the target.
spell.name: Explodet

spell.description: Creates a short gust of wind in a random direction centered at a location the caster chooses. It applies force equal to 10*X*Y lbs. Y is the size level of the object the spell is cast on. If the caster spends double MP he can choose the direction of the gust. This spell cannot cause damage directly, but can knock things over.
spell.name: Focused Gust

spell.description: One target is struck by several narrow streamers of high pressure gas. Target is struck a total of X times. Reroll damage for each strike.
spell.name: Gas Slash

spell.description: After casting, a dark, foreboding, storm blows into the region. For the duration of the spell, the caster can spend one action to call down from the sky a bolt of lightning dealing 3D10x10 U damage to any target that is outside; all objects within 10 feet of the target take half damage from this strike. In addition, for the duration of the spell the caster can take an action to throw a bolt of lightning from his fingers dealing 1D10x5 U damage to the target, and all objects that are lined up behind the target for up to 50 feet.
spell.name: Grand Storm

spell.description: The caster calls down a large bolt of lightning from the sky, striking one target. (fire effect). Anything within 5' of the strike takes half damage. This only works outdoors.
spell.name: Great Bolt

spell.description: Caster launches a bolt of lightning from his/her outstretched hands, which attacks a single target.
spell.name: Heavy Spark

spell.description: Invokes a gas explosion within the target
spell.name: Invert pressure

spell.description: One of the caster's forearm and hand is surrounded by a sheath of electricity. Anything the caster touches with the gauntlet takes listed damage. Due to the size of the gauntlet, the caster gets a +1 to strike with it (use unarmed combat, or similar skill to strike).
spell.name: Lightning Gauntlet

spell.description: A large column of lightning streams out from the caster. The stream can be a maximum of 100 feet long, and deals 1D10x5 U damage to all that are caught within the stream. Only large, inorganic, nonmetallic objects (e.g. stone wall, hill, etc.) can stop the lightning stream. For the duration of the spell, the caster can use an action to re-point the spell so that it can damage a different set of opponents.
spell.name: Lightning Stream

spell.description: Caster disassociates ambient air along a common plane, centered at the target, producing a devastating crushing blow within the target
spell.name: Pressure shift

spell.description: A more powerful version of whirlwind. Area affect: 10'x10'
spell.name: Sandstorm

spell.description: One target is barraged by thousands of high-voltage sparks emanating from all surrounding matter dealing damage and catching the target on fire. (Fire effect)
spell.name: Spark Shower

spell.description: A bolt of lightning streaks out from each finger of the caster's primary hand, for a total of 5 bolts. Each one is treated as if it was the level 4 spell Chain Lightning.
spell.name: Web Lightning

spell.description: Creates a small whirlwind that strikes one target, slashing at it with airborne stones and other particles.
spell.name: Whirlwind

spell.description: Creates a small cyclone about 6-10 feet high. Deals no damage, but can move objects weighing less than 20 lbs. GM should determine skill check, if any, to perform special manipulation of the object. The cyclone can move things around but it cannot perform careful manipulation , etc. Can also blow around dirt, fan flames, etc. Creatures inside the cyclone require a dex check at -4 to remain standing.
spell.name: Willy-Willy

spell.description: Generates a circular wall (as Wind Wall), ten feet in radius, three feet thick, thirty feet high, of fast-moving air surrounding the caster. (HP=300)
spell.name: Wind Screen

spell.description: Tosses one target into the air, where it is torn apart by strong crosswinds. If the target is wearing armor there is a 75% chance that it will be destroyed if it is soft armor, 25% chance if it is hard. The armor does protect against the damage of the spell.
spell.name: Wind Shear

spell.description: Creates a large wall of swirling air, three feet thick, 50 feet x 25 feet in size. The wall has 200 HP. It is damaged normally by explosions or air, or physical magic. It takes half damage from fire and no damage from other sources. The wall is oriented as the caster wishes, but one edge must be on the ground. Things can pass 1' through the wall per action, if they pass a STR check at -3*size.
spell.name: Wind Wall

spell.description: Up to 4 targets gains 1 action per turn
spell.name: Advanced Haste

spell.description: Up to 4 targets loose 1 action per turn. Remember that any combatant can never have less than 1 action per turn.
spell.name: Advanced Slow

spell.description: The caster summons a dark purple cloud into existence that is a mile in radius centered on the caster. If anyone, not including the caster, attempts to cast a spell when under the cloud, a bolt of anti-magic strikes the person attempting the spell. If a target is struck by this anti-magic they must make a WIL check at a -10, or take damage equal to the MP cost of the spell cast divided by 5, and fail the casting of their spell.
spell.name: Anti-Magic Cloud

spell.description: Caster may raise and lower his body (vertical direction only, 10 mph)
spell.name: Autolevitation

spell.description: Caster creates a magical copy of any one target, as Shadow Servant. It has armor & HP equivalent to the target. It vanishes if it's HP goes negative. Copy cannot, however, use any defensive skills, dodge, etc.
spell.name: Dark Servant

spell.description: Destroys any one magical barrier or field-effect spell
spell.name: Destroy Barrier

spell.description: Caster removes target creature from this dimension. Caster must win willpower contest with target in order to be successful. (caster gets +1 to his WIL in this contest per 100 extra MP spent)
spell.name: Dimensional Shift

spell.description:
[LaTeX]
Disenchant is used to remove magical effects from an object or area. Each casting of Disenchant affects a single magical spell or effect. If disenchant is used on a spell of 3$^{rd}$ rank or lower, then the targeted spell effect instantly expires (stops). If disenchant is used on a spell of 4$^{th}$ rank or higher, then the spell may or may not be affected. In this case the caster of Disenchant enters a contest of skills (Magical Control) with the original caster of the existing spell, with the following conditions:
\begin{enumerate} \item The Original caster of the spell (even if he is deceased) rolls Magical Control using the statistics he had at the time the original spell was first cast. Furthermore, he adds the rank of that spell to his roll. \item The caster of disenchant rolls Magical Control using his current statistics. Furthermore, he may add +1 to his roll for each 50 MP spent beyond the original casting cost of Disenchant. \item If the original caster wins the contest, the original spell remains in effect, unchanged. If the disenchant caster wins the contest, the original spell instantly stops functioning. In both cases the caster of disenchant looses the MP spent. \end{enumerate}
\quotexample[Br\c{a}\"{e}tzn\.{r} attempts to disenchant]{Five years ago Ulek the Pious cast Major Ward on a lockbox containing some scrolls. Now, having slain Ulek, an evil wizard, Br\c{a}\"{e}tzn\.{r} wishes to disenchant Major Ward so that he can open the box unharmed.
Because Major Ward is 5$^{th}$ rank, Disenchant does not automatically work, and a skill contest is required.
Even though Ulek is dead, ``he'' is still entitled to a roll. The GM determines that Ulek had Magical Control level 4 and WIL 15 at the time Major Ward was first cast. Thus, Ulek's roll is 4 dice + 15 (from wisdom) and +5 from the spell level. The GM keeps this information secret, and rolls for Ulek: Three successes.
The evil wizard now rolls: He has Lvl 5 Magical Control, a WIL of 14, and he chooses to spend an extra 250 MP which gives him +5 to his roll. His roll is 5 dice + 19, and comes up four successes.
Because the evil wizard wins the skill contest, disenchant is successful and Major Ward disappears.}
spell.name: Disenchant

spell.description: One target receives +2 to all attributes for the duration of the spell
spell.name: Enlighten

spell.description: Affects any one target. Whenever the target performs a damage causing action, it takes 25% of that damage itself, as D
spell.name: Field of Retribution

spell.description: All targets within 30 feet of the caster cannot speak or cast magic for the duration of the spell. Affects the Caster.
spell.name: Field of Silence

spell.description: One target receives +2 to all attributes for the duration of the spell. Target also receives +1 action and +3 to all skill rolls
spell.name: Glorious Aura

spell.description: Time stops around the caster for 1D4 turns. The caster do as he wishes within the duration. Any spells cast, or attacks made will not deal damage until Halt Time expires.
spell.name: Halt Time

spell.description: Target gains 1 action per turn
spell.name: Haste

spell.description: Caster encases any one target in a cubical, glasslike magical box. Walls of the box will transmit light and air or water, but nothing else. Roll WIL vs. the intended target otherwise the spell fails.
spell.name: Imprison

spell.description: Caster may raise and lower one physical object with a maximum mass of 40 lb (vertical direction only, 10 mph)
spell.name: Levitate Object

spell.description: One target receives +2 to all attributes for the duration of the spell. Target also receives double dice on all skill rolls. Target gets a +1 bonus to all damage rolls, and reduces damage of any incoming attacks by up to 10 points of damage.
spell.name: Light Curtain

spell.description: One target loses all their MP. They take damage equal to the amount of MP lost, divided by 5.
spell.name: Mana Burn

spell.description: No spells may be cast in within 30 feet
spell.name: Mana Drain-2

spell.description: One target loses 1D6*20 MP which is transferred to the caster
spell.name: Mana Sap

spell.description: All desired targets within a 100 foot radius from some point desired by the caster gain 1 action per turn. Remember that a person cannot have less than 1 action per turn.
spell.name: Mass Haste

spell.description: Up to 4 targets cannot speak or cast magic for the duration of the spell
spell.name: Mass Silence

spell.description: All desired targets within a 100 foot radius from some point desired by the caster lose 1 action per turn. Remember that a person cannot have less than 1 action per turn.
spell.name: Mass Slow

spell.description: Target loses 1D6 x 10 MP which is transferred to the caster
spell.name: Minor Mana Sap

spell.description: One target may not cast any spells for the duration of Negate. If the target attempts to cast a spell, he must make a WIL check at -10. If successful, the caster casts the spell attempted. If the check fails, the caster takes undefined damage equal to the MP cost of the spell attempted divided by 5.
spell.name: Negate

spell.description: Roll magical control. Caster may ask one humanoid target one yes/no question for each success which the target must answer truthfully. The caster may continue asking questions beyond that point, but target can then attempt to lie by passing a WIL check at -5.
spell.name: Questioning

spell.description: One target gets a bonus of +2D4 to their initiative.
spell.name: Quicken

spell.description: Redirect any aspects of a spell you cast to another target. This must be cast at the same time as another spell.
spell.name: Redirect Effect

spell.description: Allows the caster to determine the core statistics of any one target. (HP, skills, equipment possessed, etc.) If there is a perception test involving a scanned target, the caster recives +3 on the roll due to the benefits of this spell. Target must be within sight range and the caster must be aware of the target in order to cast.
spell.name: Scan

spell.description: Gives the caster an ability to instantly and accurately determine the magical nature of things within his vision. It does NOT imply knowledge of what the magic does, merely if it is magical or not. This spell can be useful for identifying illusions, as they always appear magical.
