spell.name: Sense magic

spell.description: Caster creates a magical copy of any one target. Copy will stand beside target and will do whatever the target does (effectively doubling the actions of target) If shadow takes any damage (even one point!--and it has NO armor) it vanishes, dealing 2D6 U to the original target.
spell.name: Shadow Servant

spell.description: One target cannot speak or cast magic for the duration of the spell
spell.name: Silence

spell.description: All spells cast within 30 feet radius cast without gems/stones require double MP to cast
spell.name: Simple Mana Drain

spell.description: Target loses 1 action per turn. Remember that any combatant can never have less than 1 action per turn.
spell.name: Slow

spell.description: One target receives +2 to all physical attributes for the duration of the spell
spell.name: Strengthen

spell.description: Area effect of 30 feet. All targets in the area suffer 1D4 * (X/5) U damage, except the caster.
spell.name: Tainted Mana

spell.description: Caster gains magical flight. Max speed = 30 MPH.
spell.name: True Flight

spell.description: Adds +1D6-1 to target's attributes, divided how caster chooses but cannot make an attribute more than 20, and cannot be cast again on the same target until the effects wear off.
spell.name: Twink

spell.description: Instantly removes all magical enchantment, etc. from one item, person, or area. Caster must expend additional MP equal to the total MP used in enchanting the item (or spell to be removed)
spell.name: Unbind

spell.description: Adds +1 to summon score
spell.name: Beast Lore 1

spell.description: Adds +10 to summon score
spell.name: Beast Lore 10

spell.description: Adds +2 to summon score
spell.name: Beast Lore 2

spell.description: Adds +3 to summon score
spell.name: Beast Lore 3

spell.description: Adds +4 to summon score
spell.name: Beast Lore 4

spell.description: Adds +5 to summon score
spell.name: Beast Lore 5

spell.description: Adds +6 to summon score
spell.name: Beast Lore 6

spell.description: Adds +7 to summon score
spell.name: Beast Lore 7

spell.description: Adds +8 to summon score
spell.name: Beast Lore 8

spell.description: Adds +9 to summon score
spell.name: Beast Lore 9

spell.description: Caster may extend the duration of a Circle spell. +X D6 rounds
spell.name: Bolster Circle

spell.description: Allows caster to add +X to his summon score.
spell.name: Channel Summon

spell.description: Creates a circular marking on the floor/ground which is Summon Rank feet in diameter. Beasts must pass a WIL contest vs. the caster in order to enter the circle, with the Caster at +5 to his roll.
spell.name: Circle Against Beasts

spell.description: Creates a circular marking on the floor/ground which is Summon Rank feet in diameter. Constructs must pass a WIL contest vs. the caster in order to enter the circle, with the Caster at +5 to his roll.
spell.name: Circle Against Constructs

spell.description: Creates a circular marking on the floor/ground which is Summon Rank feet in diameter. Demons must pass a WIL contest vs. the caster in order to enter the circle, with the Caster at +5 to his roll.
spell.name: Circle Against Demons

spell.description: Creates a circular marking on the floor/ground which is Summon Rank feet in diameter. Monsters must pass a WIL contest vs. the caster in order to enter the circle, with the Caster at +5 to his roll.
spell.name: Circle Against Monsters

spell.description: Creates a circular marking on the floor/ground which is Summon Rank feet in diameter. Outsiders must pass a WIL contest vs. the caster in order to enter the circle, with the Caster at +5 to his roll.
spell.name: Circle Against Outsiders

spell.description: Creates a circular marking on the floor/ground which is Summon Rank feet in diameter. Undead must pass a WIL contest vs. the caster in order to enter the circle, with the Caster at +5 to his roll.
spell.name: Circle Against Undead

spell.description: As gate, except that the summoned creature(s) follow complex and specific commands issued by the summoner. While this spell is in effect the creatures are assumed to have the mental attributes of the caster. The caster must remain motionless during this spell's duration. The caster effectivley controls the summoned creatures. (See Beast Magic rules)
spell.name: Command

spell.description: Allows caster to communicate mentally (similar to Telepathy) with animals
spell.name: Communicate with Animals

spell.description: Summons one or more creatures to within sight range of the caster. Creatures maintain their own free will; they are merely transported to the new location. (See Beast Magic rules)
spell.name: Gate

spell.description: Cast on one target creature. Target becomes caster's familiar. Caster and Familiar have limited empathic ability. Familiar becomes loyal to the caster, and is bound to obey simple commands as summon. (See Beast Magic rules)
spell.name: Pact

spell.description: As gate, except that creatures summoned are bound to follow one very simple directive given by the caster. Example: Protect X, or Attack Y (See Beast Magic rules)
spell.name: Summon

spell.description: Caster transforms himself into an alternate form. Caster retains his own mental attributes but assumes the physical attributes, abilities, and form of the new creature. (See Beast Magic rules)
spell.name: Transform

spell.description: Caster may alter the size of one object +/- 100 %. This can only affect non-living targets. The target must be a single object; it cannot work on machines.
spell.name: Alter Size

spell.description: Caster unleashes an unrelenting attack of flying, exploding, and falling stones on an area. Targets in the area are struck 1D6 times per size level. Each hit does the listed damage.
spell.name: Cataclysm

spell.description: Opens or closes a fissure in the ground, up to 15 feet long, 5 feet wide, 20 feet deep.
spell.name: Chasm

spell.description: Creates a hole with radius 2 feet in earth, rock, brick, etc. (Max thickness = 2 feet)
spell.name: Create Portal

spell.description: Caster creates a small (1/2 lb) stone in the palm of his hand. Can also be used to make a stone larger by 1/2 lb. The general shape can be controlled, but nothing detailed can be produced
spell.name: Create stone

spell.description: Caster can use his hands to crumble away stone, dirt, etc. as if it were soft (cake-like) in consistency. Caster can shape up to 5 cubic feet of stone before the spell wears off. Otherwise it will wear off in 1D6 minutes. The shaping performed by the caster is permanent. This spell cannot effect man-made materials like artificial stone or concrete.
spell.name: Crumble

spell.description: An area, 20 feet in radius around a point the caster chooses, is enchanted with growing stalagmites. Every turn, 2D4 stalagmites rapidly grow out of the ground, impaling anything above the area. These stalagmites can be targeted by the caster, and remain as permanent fixtures upon the ground once created. Each stalagmite must use the Roll to strike, and each deals the listed damage.
spell.name: Dance of Stalagmites

spell.description: One geographic area, up to 10 square miles, will start to deform into a type of terrain desired by the caster. The process takes 1D6 days, and can include movement, creation, or destruction of land masses; but not the living things in that area.
spell.name: Deformation

spell.description: Creates a cloud of sand, dust, and dirt in the air. The cloud will dissipate normally. The cloud measures no larger than 5' x 5' x 5' per X
spell.name: Dustcloud

spell.description: A large quantity (3 cubic yards) of dirt is changed to hard stone
spell.name: Earth to Stone

spell.description: The caster creates a giant arm and hand of rocks and dirt, that rises out of the ground. The arm mimics the movement of the caster's arm and can strike or grapple targets. Use unarmed combat or similar skill to strike with. The arm has STR equal to the Caster's WIL times the number of succeses made on a Magical Control roll. The arm can stay in existance for 10 MP/turn.
spell.name: Earthen Fist

spell.description: Creates a huge mouth-like chasm (20' long, 10' deep, 6' wide) along the ground lined with sharp stone, under the target. Each turn the target is trapped within the maw, it suffers listed damage. Target can avoid the maw by making a DEX check at -10. To get out of the maw, the target must make a STR check at -10 vs. the caster's WIL +LVL of Magical Control.
spell.name: Earthen Maw

spell.description: A 10 foot wide seismic fissure opens, trapping and crushing those who fall in. Creatures within the effect must make a DEX check at a -10 or fall into the fissure.
spell.name: Fissure

spell.description: Creates a large mass of stone 10 feet in diameter held in the air above a target. It then falls, crushing the target and burying it underneath tons of earth.
spell.name: Geo Press

spell.description: The ground swallows the caster and up to 1 ton of additional mass and instantly transports him to any location via underground. May only transport to/from and through areas of soil, rock, etc. Cannot pass through concrete, refined metals, wood, etc. All items to be transported must be within 10' of the caster.
spell.name: Geo Transport

spell.description: Caster may alter the size of one object +/- 500 %. This can only affect non-living targets. The target must be a single object; it cannot work on machines.
spell.name: Greatly Alter Size

spell.description: The caster creates a small earthquake, causing large-scale seismic damage within 30 feet of the epicenter
spell.name: Invoke Quake

spell.description: Allows the caster to sculpt structures out of naturally occurring rocks, dirt, etc. Caster may move up to 2 cubic yards of material. After the spell's duration unstable sections will collapse.
spell.name: Manipulate Earth

spell.description: Magically pushes a target away from the caster. The target is pushed a distance of (2000 / weight in lbs.) feet. The push travels directly away from the caster. This spell cannot deal damage intrinsically, but it can be used to push something down a hole or against a trap, etc.
spell.name: Push

spell.description: Caster sends a nearby stone hurtling towards one target. When it gets near the target it explodes, sending razor-sharp shards flying in all directions.
spell.name: Rock Bomb

spell.description: A hard, stone-like layer coats one object that is no larger than 4 feet in any one dimension. Moving objects must be traveling less than 5 MPH. The rock layer is 1 inch thick.
spell.name: Rock Encasement

spell.description: Caster creates a snake-like living golem out of stone. It is controllable by the caster for the duration of the spell. It cannot dodge, but it can attack and parry with it's claws. Damage is 3D4+1 S claws, 6D6+1 C bite and 4D10 C tail. It has 5 dice to attack and 3 actions/turn. Armor is equal to caster's WIL in all categories and has X HP.
spell.name: Rock Serpent

spell.description: A large quantity (3 cubic yards) of rock or concrete is changed into a loose, wet mud
spell.name: Rock to Mud

spell.description: Initiates the movement of dirt, stones, in the surrounding area into a giant wave that crashes into the target area. Deals a total of 6x 4D6 C damage divided however the user chooses among up to 6 targets. Can only be used around suitable material for the spell. Can deal no more than 100 damage per size level of any one target.
spell.name: Rockslide

spell.description: Caster creates a thin wall of dirt, sand, and stones suspended in the air. Wall takes no damage from physical attacks. The wall can be struck X times, then it crumbles to dust. Wall can be oriented however the caster wishes, but must have a surface area no greater than 100 square feet. Wall has no effect versus energy weapons, purely magical/elemental attacks, or anything with AP.
spell.name: Screen of Stones

spell.description: Generates a foot-high wave of seismic activity that travels outward from the caster in all directions to a range of 25*X feet. Any objects struck by wave suffer damage. X can be no greater than his level of Magical Control. Permanent structures take quadruple damage.
spell.name: Seismic Wave

spell.description: A single target and an area 5 feet in radius is barraged by thousands of small stones.
spell.name: Stone Rain

spell.description: A statue, approximately 8 feet tall, rises from the ground and attacks any opponents that come near it. The statue has 10/10/10 armor and 200 HP. It has a reach of 15 feet with it's stone arms, and deals 4D6+1 C damage. It has an attack and parry skill of a 5, and has 4 actions per turn.
spell.name: Stone Sentry

spell.description: One target gains a layer of stone-like external armor. The stone armor cover's the targets own skin, and provides armor with values (2+X) / (2*X) / (1+X)
spell.name: Stone Skin

spell.description: Caster transforms his body into a dense, hard stone. DEX becomes 10. Gain 30/30/20 armor and quadruple normal HP. Cannot use complex weapons (e.g. guns, high tech, etc.) STR becomes four times normal.
spell.name: Stoneform

spell.description: Generates a billowing cloud of ashes, smoke, and glowing embers filling a cube measuring 20' on a side. Anything in the cloud suffers 5D4 U from the heat. Anyone who breathes in the cloud will take an additional 2D4 U damage per turn. Remaining in the cloud longer than 1 turn will cause objects to set on fire (Fire effect). Cloud naturally dissipates after spell duration runs out.
spell.name: Ashen cloud

spell.description:
One archaic weapon is enhanced with magical fire. The fire does not harm the weapon itself. However, it will burn other objects that the weapon may touch.
Adds Fire effect to the weapon and also a +2 bonus to the damage roll.
spell.name: Burning Blade

spell.description: The caster's body is burned to ash by consuming flame. For the duration of the spell the caster is immune to all physical and fire damage, though water spells deal double damage. Everything with 50 feet of the caster take 2D6 U damage from the heat per turn; everything within 20 feet of the caster takes 6D6 U damage per turn. Anything the caster touches (including what he's standing on) takes 5D6+3 U damage. Any living object the caster touches must make a BLD check or be reduced to ashes. At the end of the spell's duration the caster's body is restored. If the caster dies before the duration expires, the caster detonates in a massive explosion dealing 5D6+1 x 5 U damage to everything within 50 feet.
spell.name: Effigy

spell.description: Caster may extinguish normal fire (Magical Control^2 square yards)
spell.name: Extinguish Fire

spell.description: Caster launches a fireball, which strikes the target and detonates. The exact target suffers double damage. Everything within 20 feet of the detonation takes standard damage.
spell.name: Fireball

spell.description: a sizeable spear of flaming energy strikes the target (fire effect)
spell.name: Fireblast

spell.description: Several (3D4) flaming projectiles strike the target (fire effect) The entire spell does rated damage, not each projectile. This will ignite all flammable materials in/on the target
spell.name: Firestorm

spell.description: Creates a small flaming ball of energy. It can be thrown up to 50 feet away as though it were a rock, or it can be smacked against an opponent in a hand-to-hand attack. Fire effect
spell.name: Flame

spell.description: The caster throws a 1D(4+X) burst of small fireballs at one target. Each does rated damage. (fire effect)
spell.name: Flame Shards

spell.description: The caster's body is covered with magical fire. The caster & his carried items suffer no damage, but anything contacting the fire suffers 2D4 U damage. Caster also gains 4/4/4 Armor, and +4 to base armor.
spell.name: Flame Shroud

spell.description: Creates a large wall of magical fire, 3 x 50 x 25 feet, oriented as the caster wishes. Anything passing through the wall suffers 6D4+1 U damage (with fire effect). Cannot be cast on a living target.
spell.name: Flame Wall

spell.description: The caster creates a three-foot high wave of magical fire that travels out from the caster to a maximum range of 50 feet. +2 to strike. Will travel up, over & down surfaces it contacts, but cannot bridge gaps, etc.
spell.name: Flame Wave

spell.description: A 20 foot long tendril of fire stretches from the caster's hand. For the duration of the spell, the caster can spend one action to make an attack with the whip, dealing listed damage. Use the caster's Magical Control skill to strike with a bonus of +2.
spell.name: Flame Whip

spell.description: This spell works as Fireball, except that the central 5' radius area suffers double damage. A 30' radius suffers standard damage, and half damage extends out to 50' radius. Areas have Fire effect X4, X2, and F respectively.
spell.name: Great Fireball

spell.description: One inanimate object's temperature is increased by (100 / mass in Kg) degrees C.
spell.name: Heat Item

spell.description: Tendrils of flame lash out from a point specified by the caster, showering the area with deadly flame. This will cause damage to any targets desired by the caster, even through fire-resistant armor. Fire will spread rapidly from ignited targets and can only be extinguished by magical or supernatural means. The fire will burn out naturally after 2D6 minutes. This spell can be stopped by forcefields or similar high-tech defenses, or magic.
spell.name: Hellstorm

spell.description: The caster is enveloped in tendrils of fire. If any opponent comes within 15 feet of the caster, the fire surrounding the caster will lash out with a spear of fire, dealing listed damage. Each turn that target is within 15 feet of the caster, that target will be struck again.
spell.name: Living Fire
spell.target: Auto, Roll to strike with the spears

spell.description: A geyser of molten rock erupts from the ground under one target, which suffers the listed damage. All objects within 20 feet of the eruption will be splashed with lava, sustaining half damage and suffering Fire Effect x3 for the next 2D4 turns. All armor within the area of effect lose 1D4 to all armor values per turn. Damage cannot be prevented by fire resistant armor. This spell can be stopped by forcefields or similar high-tech defenses, or magic.
spell.name: Magma Fountain

spell.description: Caster forms and throws a deadly missile of pressurized, molten stone at any one target. Target suffers full damage. Upon impact, the dart emits a blast of heat dealing half damage to all objects within 10 feet. Items hit by this spell are severely damaged from the heat. If armor is hit, it will have all armor values reduced by 1D4 until repaired. Even heat-resistant armor, etc, has half effectiveness.
spell.name: Magma dart

spell.description: Summons a small flaming meteor that launches at one target dealing 6D6+1 U fire damage, and 6D6+3 C damage. All objects within 20 yards radius suffers half damage from the fire. Damage can only be prevented by rank 6 or higher magical barrier or supernatural immunity to fire. An area of 20 yards around the impact will burn for the duration of the spell dealing 3D4+1 U fire damage to all objects.
spell.name: Meteor

spell.description: Caster projects a deadly beam of heat from his outstretched hand. The beam ignores energy defenses such as forcefields, as well as armor with the fire-resistant property. The target will ignite even if fireproof, etc. Only magical fire resistance, magical barriers, or extremely large non-flammable solid objects are proof against this spell.
spell.name: Ray of Heat

spell.description: Creates an arrow-like dart of blazing fire which flies towards one target. This spell does not have Fire effect.
spell.name: Red Arrow

spell.description: One target gains permanent fire protection (cannot be set on fire) & sustains half damage from fire or heat-based sources.
spell.name: Resist Fire

spell.description: Generates a circular wall, ten feet in radius, three feet thick, thirty feet high, of flames surrounding the caster. Anything passing through the wall suffers 6D4+1 U damage.
spell.name: Ring of Fire

spell.description: Caster touches any kind of flame or fire that happens to be nearby while spell is active and coverts the heat into life energy. The caster GAINS 1D6 HP/turn for normal fire or 1D8+1 for intense/magical fire. The caster can soak a fire-based attack/spell with a successful magical control check with a - equal to the rank of the attack/spell. Upon succeeding the caster gains HP equal to half the spell's damage. On failing the caster suffers half normal damage instead.
spell.name: Soak Fire

spell.description: Caster snaps his fingers producing sparks and a small lighter-like flame. Fire effect. The flame can be maintained by spending 5 MP per minute. Producing the flame will not harm the caster.
spell.name: Spark

spell.description: Brings one dead humanoid or animal back to life. Requires a reasonably intact corpse. Target has full HP, but suffers -2 to all attributes. Target is considered undead. Every 24 hours that pass causes the target to loose 1 WIL point. When WIL drops to zero target becomes a Zombie. Target can be restored to normal if Regrowth, Purify, and Purge are cast on the target.before WIL runs out.
spell.name: Animate

spell.description:
Instantly nullifies all foreign chemicals in one target: good AND bad. This affects drugs of any sort, poisions (ingested or otherwise), venom or posion from bites or stings, and so forth.
Make a Magical Control check to see if the spell effects posions of a magical nature. This spell has no effect against living creatures or infectious organisms such as bacteria/diseases/viruses.
Note that this spell may bring temporary relief to victims of bacterial diseases becasue it eliminates any toxins that may be present. However, it does not eliminate the root cause of the illness in that case.
spell.name: Antidote

spell.description: Target enchants one target with an aura of positive energy. Target recives +1 to damage rolls, x2 dice on all academic skill rolls, +2 to all attributes, +1 action, and damage reduction of 10 for the extent of the spell. This spell does not stack with Haste.
spell.name: Battle Aura

spell.description: Target may breathe any fluid medium as if it was normal, clean air. Target does not suffocate and is not harmed by any poisonous effects the substance may have while the spell is in effect. The fluid must be thin enough to be inhaled and exhaled. This will allow the character to breathe smoke, gas (posion or otherwise), water, oxygen-deficient air, etc.
spell.name: Breathe Without Air

spell.description: Allows caster to communicate naturally with any human, as if they both spoke the same language
spell.name: Communicate with Humans

spell.description: Target looses 1D4 HP every hour until dead or spell expires. Note that this is not damage per se, and cannot be prevented short of magical healing.
spell.name: Corrupt

spell.description: Target now suffers critical failures on a roll of 1 through 4 on all skill and attribute rolls. As well, target has -3 to all their rolls.
spell.name: Curse

spell.description: Brings one target back to life. That target's life thread is now attached to the caster, but not the other way around. If the target dies at a later date, and the caster still remains alive, then the target is regenerated and resurrected at full HP within 1D6 turns. There is no limit to the number of times that the target can be resurrected in this fashion. If the caster dies, the target's life thread is severed and the target dies.
spell.name: Curse of the Uu

spell.description: Causes direct biological damage in one target, and poisons the target. The disease causes the victim to loose 2 actions and suffer 4D4+1 U damage per turn until duration expires
spell.name: Deathly Haze

spell.description:
Cures all basic bacterial diseases and infections in one target.
Has no effect on magical diseases of any sort.
spell.name: Disinfect

spell.description: Caster touches one target and attempts to end it's vital life processes. Caster must make a successful Magical Control check for the spell to work. If the target fails a BLD check, it drops to 0 HP instantly. Thereafter it looses size * 1D6+1 HP per turn until dead. During this time, the target cannot regain conciousness by itself, but it can be healed by outside forces.
spell.name: Disrupt life

spell.description: Enchants one creature with a death curse. Once the spell is cast the curse takes effect, indicating to the target how much time it has left to live. After 1D6+1 turns the creature must roll a BLD check at -5. Failure means instant death and there is a 50% chance the corpse is destroyed. Success means the creature drops to 1 HP instead. This spell cannot be disenchanted. Sanctuary will temporarily stall the countdown. Disenchant + Purify + Restore will halt the spell.
spell.name: Doom

spell.description: Caster sucks away the target's vital essence causing biological damage. (no effect vs. undead, spirits, or non-living targets like robots)
spell.name: Drain

spell.description: One target regenerates 3D4+2 HP per turn for (3+ 2D6+1) turns
spell.name: Greater Regeneration

spell.description: Magical curing heals life-threatening wounds
spell.name: Heal Major Wounds

spell.description: Magical curing heals major wounds
spell.name: Heal Wounds

spell.description: Can only be cast on a target below 0 hit points. The target will not lose any HP from blood loss for the duration of the spell. Also gives the target +3 on WIL checks to remain concious.
spell.name: Hold Life

spell.description: Restores 2D4 HP to one target. Requires skin-to-skin contact to cast.
spell.name: Lesser Heal

spell.description: Allows caster to determine the cause of death of a recently deceased living creature. This spell requires at least half of the remains of the deceased in order to be cast.
spell.name: Limited Divination

spell.description: Target instantly gains X HP.
spell.name: Magic Healing

spell.description: Caster corrupts one target's body, infusing it with a flesh consuming poison. This causes the target to suffer the listed damage on each of its turns until the spell's duration expires or the poison is otherwise nullified. No effect on spirits or robots.
spell.name: Poison

spell.description: Caster frees the target's body of all artificial modifications, diseases, influences, viruses, posions, and other tangible afflictions (magical or otherwise). The process causes the target to loose 2D4 HP (nothing can counter this loss of life) and also take 1D4 BLD. When used on the self, the spell takes 0 actions and costs 100 MP; on an outside target, the spell takes 1 action and 300 MP. The target can make a WIL check to resist the effects of the spell.
spell.name: Purge

spell.description: Cures all diseases, infections, cancerous growth, drug/posion effects, cancerous growths, etc, in one target. This spell does affect magical afflictions, curses, and the like.
spell.name: Purify

spell.description: Brings one dead humanoid back to life. Requires a reasonably intact corpse. Target now is at 1 HP, and suffers -1 to all attributes and -1 level to all skills. Casting Regrowth and Purify on the target will remove the attribute and skill penalties.
spell.name: Raise Dead

spell.description:
This spell greatly accelerates the natural healing processes of one target, boosting the target's vitality and closing wounds at a fast rate.
While this spell is in effect, the target gains 1D4+1 HP per turn. Furthermore, this spell allows severed limbs to reattach if the limb is held against the stump. Any excessive bleeding (such as HP loss from dropping below 0 or from severe wounds) will instantly stop.
spell.name: Regeneration

spell.description:
This is a specialized healing spell which forces the body to regenerate new organs and limbs.
Casting this spell will regrow any single limb, appendage, or organ, except for the brain. This is effective even if the body part is missing entirely (such as a severed limb), or is damaged due to disease or injury.
This spell also heals sensory deprivation such as blindness, deafness, or inability to speak even if there is no obvious cause.
spell.name: Regrowth

spell.description: Brings one dead target back to life as a random creature. The type of creature is determined by the worth of the target reincarnated. A target who has proved its worth (not necessarily good worth) will be brought back to life as a creature greater than it was. If the target was found unworthy, it is brought back as some creature less than it was. This check of worthiness is determined by the GM, as is the type of creature the target is reincarnated into. Requires at least some remains of the target to be reincarnated.
spell.name: Reincarnation

spell.description: Magical curing completely heals one target, bringing them to full HP. This spell is only effective if the target is still alive (it will not aid a dead target)
spell.name: Restore

spell.description: Brings one dead humanoid back to life at 5 HP. Corpse must be reasonably intact and this spell must be cast within 24 hrs. of death.
spell.name: Resurrection

spell.description: Caster may reverse the natural aging process (decay, rusting, etc?) of any one non-living object as much as he/she wishes. Will not affect damage caused by combat, etc.
spell.name: Reverse Aging

spell.description: Caster gains HP rather than suffering damage from any one incoming attack
spell.name: Reverse Damage

spell.description: One target's soul is marked for death. Furthermore, the target instantly dies unless they can succeed on a BLD check at -5. When the target dies (which may be immedietly) they cannot be resurrected. If cast on a target that is already dead, the target can no longer be resurrected. Pulse of Life, if affecting a target whose soul has been marked but who has not yet died, will remove the mark.
spell.name: Soul Burn

spell.description: Cures all advanced bacterial and viral diseases/infections in one target, including those of a magical nature.
spell.name: Sterilize

spell.description: Bring one target back to life, but with the caster's and the target's life threads attached. If at any point in the future either dies, the other dies as well.
spell.name: Ties of Life

spell.description: Brings one dead humanoid back to life at full HP. Requires at least some remains of the target to be resurrected. May be cast any time after death.
spell.name: True Resurrection

spell.description: Caster inflicts 2+X D4 U damage on any one target and gains an equal number of HP in the process. Does not work on robots or spirits. If cast on Undead it will have the opposite effect.
spell.name: Vampiric Drain

spell.description: Causes direct biological damage in one target, and poisons the target. The disease causes the victim to loose 1 action and suffer 4D4 U damage per turn until duration expires. No effect on spirits or robots
spell.name: Venom

spell.description: Causes direct biological damage in one target, and has a 50% chance to give the target a nasty disease. The disease causes the victim to loose 1 action and suffer 1+ 1D6U damage per turn until duration expires
spell.name: Virus

spell.description: A wisp of white light flows through a dead creature, bringing it back to life at full HP. The wisp then travels to the next creature, doing the same. At least some portion of the creature must still remain before Winds of Resurrection is cast, and the body must be within 150' of the caster. One creature is brought back to life a turn. The wisp will bring back to life any number of creatures up to twice the caster's level in Magical Control. May be cast any time after a creature's death.
spell.name: Winds of Resurrection

spell.description: Allows the caster to determine the general alignment and mood of any living creature he/she sees. Gives +2 to perception rolls that involve living things. Note that ghosts, undead, etc. aren't alive so they have no aura. Also, this spell allows the caster to see the aura of invisible creatures which will give away their approximate location. Auras are only visible if they are out in the open, so the caster cannot see auras of beings behind walls, etc.
spell.name: Aura Sight

spell.description: Caster becomes invisible (as Grant Invisibility)
spell.name: Autoinvisibility

spell.description: Caster becomes invisible--cannot be detected via above means, OR radar/sonar & similar means
spell.name: Autoinvisibility 2

spell.description: Caster becomes invisible--cannot be detected by any physical (non-magical / psionic) means
spell.name: Autoinvisibility 3

spell.description: Caster may manipulate the direction of a light source. Caster cannot alter the power of light, but can make it bend around corners, spread out, focus, etc. Cannot cause any damage. Can be used to deflect lasers.
spell.name: Bend Light

spell.description: Caster can instantly disperse or redirect any light or light-based weapon (including lasers and similar energy weapons). Dispersion is automatic, Redirect requires a magical control roll at -3.
spell.name: Bend Light II

spell.description: Generates a massive flash of light (Effect = GM's discretion)
spell.name: Blinding Flash

spell.description: Caster generates a large (3' diameter) orb of brilliant white light. The light shines outward like Daylight Globe, only it is twice as powerful and also has the same effects as Emanate Light. Any living creature touching the sphere gains 3D6 HP. Any demon or spirit within range of the spell will suffer 3D6 U Fire for every turn exposed to the light.
spell.name: Burning Beacon

spell.description: The caster and all objects he wears and carries will change color to mimic his surroundings. Gives a Camouflage skill of 5, or if the caster has the Camouflage skill, he gets a bonus of 5 skill levels.
spell.name: Chameleon Coat

spell.description: Caster makes his surroundings turn artificially dark and light-deficient. (100 foot radius). Dark area moves with caster as it's center.
spell.name: Create Darkness

spell.description: Caster creates a powerful inverse spotlight that sucks in light from it's surroundings, forming a dark beam. Caster may move it around at will.
spell.name: Dark Beam

spell.description: Caster forms and throws a dark black mass of energy. Upon striking a target, the ball explodes into a large area of anti-light (like Create Darkness), dealing damage to target.
spell.name: Dark Blast

spell.description: Creates a basketball-sized object that sucks in light from it's surroundings. (-100,000 cp). The caster may move the ball at will within 40 feet or his line of sight, whichever is smaller. Caster may end spell at his will.
spell.name: Darkness Globe

spell.description: Creates a basketball-sized light source that emits light but no heat. (100,000 cp). The caster may move the ball at will within 40 feet or his line of sight, whichever is smaller. Caster may end spell at his will.
spell.name: Daylight Globe

spell.description: Caster projects a beam of multicolored energy that strikes one target. Target suffers listed damage and must make a BLD check or lose 1D4 actions each turn for the next 1D4 turns.
spell.name: Dazzling Blast

spell.description: Caster summons a swirling cloud of shiny, multicolored shards of magical energy that fly towards and encircle any one target. Bypasses all personal armor (does not compromise Type 3 mecha or vehicles, etc.)
spell.name: Dazzling Gale

spell.description: Enables caster to fill a large area (100 foot radius) with bright, daylight emanating from nothingness. Caster may move lit area at will. This will reveal illusions, invisible objects/creatures. It can shine through any kind of darkness, magical or otherwise. All persons in the lit area recive +2 to perception rolls.
spell.name: Emanate Light

spell.description: One man-sized or smaller target becomes invisible to all physical detection (light amplification, normal vision) (cannot affect caster)
spell.name: Grant Invisibility

spell.description: One target (other than caster) becomes invisible--cannot be detected via above means, OR radar/sonar & similar means
spell.name: Grant Invisibility 2

spell.description: One target (other than caster ) becomes invisible--cannot be detected by any physical (non-magical / psionic) means
spell.name: Grant Invisibility 3

spell.description: Caster may project a 6x6x6 foot (per X) illusion anywhere within his range of sight--complete with sound, thermal radiation, smell, etc.
spell.name: Greater Illusion

spell.description: Caster may project a near-perfect 6x6x6 foot (per X) sized illusion anywhere within his range of sight.
spell.name: Illusion

spell.description: Target gains the ability to distinguish temperature of objects within his normal line of sight
spell.name: Infravision

spell.description: Caster generates a powerful beam of laser energy from his outstretched hand. Beam acts like a normal laser weapon.
spell.name: Laze

spell.description: Caster may project a 6x6x6 foot (per X) sized illusion anywhere within his range of sight. Close scrutiny will reveal the true nature of the illusion
spell.name: Lesser Illusion

spell.description: Caster creates a powerful spotlight-like, bright white light source which can be moved around at will.
spell.name: Light Beam

spell.description: Generates a large (100 foot radius) area of dark, hazy, fog. This spell mimics the effects of Create Darkness, except that it does not move with the caster. Any creature other than the caster suffers 1D6+1 U every turn it remains in the dark area.
spell.name: Midnight Haze

spell.description: The caster is able to see invisible objects/creatures as if they were not invisible. Gives +1 to perception rolls, and an additional +1 if the roll involves partially invisible targets (ghosts, etc.)
spell.name: See Invisible

spell.description: Caster gains the ability to see through solid objects of his choice as if they weren't there. Caster can also see invisible beings/objects. Gives +3 to perception rolls.
spell.name: Selective Vision

spell.description: Caster can manipulate and move around shadows and darkness. Total amount of darkness cannot be changed, but may be expanded/contracted, moved, etc.
spell.name: Spreading Darkness

spell.description: Caster's body becomes permeable to normal matter. He may pass through walls, etc. at will, and can interact with objects as he chooses. Caster, however, walks on floors, stairs, etc. as normal, if he so chooses. While this spell is in effect, caster is totally silent and cannot speak or hear.
spell.name: Autophase

spell.description: Creates a hemispherical two-way magical barrier 8 feet in radius. Physical attacks penetrate at half damage Magic/Psionics unaffected. Barrier can be made one-way for double cost.
spell.name: Barrier

spell.description:
This spell is a defensive maneuver. When cast, the caster disappears and instantaneously reappears in random location within 20 feet of original location.
Roll randomly to determine the caster's new location. Note that Blink will not put the caster into an iminently dangerous spot such as in the air over a chasm, into a fire, or over a puddle of lava. However, Blink may cause the caster to reappear closer to an opponent.
This spell functions as an automatic dodge. In other words, it will allow the caster to automatically avoid being struck by any one targeted blow. Dodge is effective against physical attacks, ranged and melee weapons, projectiles, and magic spells that require a roll to strike.
Blink is NOT effective against auto-targeting magic spells (the caster simply gets hit in his new location). Blink is also not effective against area-effect spells or area-effect weapons (such as a grenade), unless the caster's new location happens to be outside the area of effect. Just like the Dodge ability, the caster must be aware of the attack he wishes to Blink from. Blink therefore cannot be used to avoid sneak attacks that the caster did not know about.
spell.name: Blink

spell.description: One surface (10x10 ft) becomes magically adhesive. Objects contacting with surface become stuck (STR check at -8 to un-stick)
spell.name: Carpet of Adhesion

spell.description: One surface (10x10 ft) becomes extremely slippery. Objects contacting the surface must make a DEX check at -8 or fall down.
spell.name: Carpet of Slipperiness

spell.description: Allows caster to communicate mentally (similar to Telepathy) with complicated machines and robots.
spell.name: Communicate with Machines

spell.description: A large gravimetric distortion forcibly compresses one target's body, attracting nearby flying objects
spell.name: Dark Matter

spell.description: Creates a hemispherical two-way magical barrier 8 feet in radius. Magical/physical/psionic attacks penetrate at one-quarter damage. Barrier can be made one-way for double MP cost.
spell.name: Energy Shield

spell.description: One object is pulled to ground as if it were several hundred times it's normal weight (cannot affect living targets, max 20 lbs original weight)
spell.name: Enhance Gravity

spell.description: Caster can invigorate one target with strength, providing double STR bonus (up to maximum) on melee attacks, and double lift/carry numbers for the duration of the spell.
spell.name: Expound Strength

spell.description: Caster can manipulate objects far away from himself as if he were touching them. Caster has -1 to attributes for every yard of distance beyond X yards.
spell.name: Extend Presence

spell.description: Target's senses become incredibly acute. (4x better than normal) May be cast cumulatively. Gives +3 to perception rolls.
spell.name: Extraordinary Senses

spell.description: A quick blast of kinetic energy is imparted to the target. Target must make DEX check at +2*SIZE or be knocked down.
spell.name: Force Blast

spell.description: Creates a hemispherical two-way magical barrier 8 feet in radius. Magical/physical/psionic attacks penetrate at half damage. Barrier can be made one-way for double cost.
spell.name: Full Barrier

spell.description: A small gravimetric distortion crushes one target
spell.name: Gravity Crush

spell.description: Several gravimetric distortions spread throughout target's body, causing immense tissue damage
spell.name: Gravity Distortion

spell.description: One target gains a massive amount of mass (but not size) for a fraction of a second, causing it to collapse upon itself, and attract large nearby objects within 20 feet.
spell.name: Gravity Well

spell.description: Caster may transport himself and up to 1000 Kg of additional mass to one location which he has seen before (photograph waives this requirement)
spell.name: Greater Teleport

spell.description: Creates a barrier around caster up to 20 feet in radius. Barrier is impenetrable. On expiration, all damage done to objects inside the barrier is reversed. If the caster dies, the barrier fails and explodes violently and any damage done becomes permanent.
spell.name: Kekkai

spell.description: Caster may transport himself and up to 2000 lb of additional mass to one location within his current range of vision
spell.name: LesserTeleport

spell.description: Creates a hemispherical two-way magical barrier 8 feet in radius. Magical attacks penetrate at half damage Physical/Psionic unaffected. Barrier can be made one-way for double cost.
spell.name: Magic Barrier

spell.description: Creates a translucent magical cup approximatley the size of a large coffee mug. It can contain up to 2 cups (16 oz) of liquid. The cup can exist only in the caster's hand. If it is let go then the spell instantly expires. The cup can contain anything that a glass or ceramic cup could normally contain including liquids, powders, or small objects. The cup does not transmit heat or chemical effects, so it can be used to safely carry lava, acid, red-hot metal, poison, or other dangerous substances.
spell.name: Magic Cup

spell.description:
Caster magically propels a small object towards one target at high speed. Damage depends on type of object thrown; usually C. The object must fit in the palm of the hand and must weigh no more than 1 lb. After striking the target, the object falls to the ground naturally.
The caster must have an object to propel with this spell. Note that even if a "weapon" is used as the projectile (such as a throwing knife), the damage remains 1D6, though the damage type is up to the GMs discretion based on what the projectile is.
spell.name: Magic Missile

spell.description: Creates a translucent magical pole that is 5 feet long and 1 inch in diameter. The caster can move the pole around with his hands, and can choose to fix it in place (by letting go of the pole) if he so chooses. When fixed, the pole remains held in position magically until the spell expires. Applying in excess of 400 lbs of force to the pole will make it shatter and disappear. The pole may be used as a Jo staff.
spell.name: Magic Pole

spell.description: Caster can add 1D100 percent effectiveness to a physical event taking place that he is not involved with. This can only be simple things and cannot directly cause any damage, nor can it effect game mechanics rolls.
spell.name: Manipulate Event

spell.description: Transports caster and up to 200 lbs of equipment (must be worn or carried) to any location that is both within the caster's range of vision and is no more than 100 feet away.
spell.name: Minor Teleport

spell.description: Magically completely repairs one machine (GM may wish to impose size limit)
spell.name: Overhaul

spell.description: One object (non-living) gains the ability to pass through normal matter. The caster may pick the object up without it passing through his body.
spell.name: Phased Matter

spell.description: Creates a hemispherical two-way magical barrier 8 feet in radius. Magical/physical/psionic attacks cannot penetrate. Barrier can be made one-way for double MP cost.
spell.name: Prismatic Wall

spell.description: Creates a hemispherical two-way magical barrier 8 feet in radius. Psionics attacks penetrate at half damage Physical/Magical attacks unaffected. Barrier can be made one-way for double cost.
spell.name: Psi Barrier

spell.description: Creates a hemispherical barrier 8 feet in radius. 50% chance to deflect incoming magical/psionic/projectile attacks upon user, or block physical attack
spell.name: Reflect Shield

spell.description: Magical curing repairs robots and machines (no effect on living tissue)
spell.name: Repair Damage

spell.description: Magical curing repairs robots and machines (no effect on living tissue)
spell.name: Repair Major Damage

spell.description: Magical curing repairs robots and machines (no effect on living tissue) Can repair damaged weapons or armor.
spell.name: Repair Minor Damage

spell.description: One target gains the ability to walk or climb up and over any solid surface. This includes walls and celings. However, surfaces covered with excessive loose debris or slippery/slimy surfaces may not be safely traversed.
spell.name: Spider Climb

spell.description: Creates a totally impenetrable 1-way hemispherical barrier 4 feet in radius. This barrier is immune to break barrier, dispel, etc.
spell.name: Void Shield

spell.description: Caster lets out a soul-shattering scream. All beings that can hear the caster, and are within 150 feet of the caster must make a WIL check. If they fail the check, they die.
spell.name: Banshee's Wail

spell.description: Caster enchants any pre-existing relatively flat surface (such as a wall) to a maximum area of 200 square feet in size as to make it impenetrable to any spirit. The enchanted surface is also impenetrable to phasing and Selective Vision. Ward can be made permanent by spending ten times the normal MP cost.
spell.name: Barrier Ward

spell.description: Deals 2D10+1 U. Caster looses 1D8-1 HP.
spell.name: Black Beam

spell.description: All beings within range loose 1 action next turn, suffer listed damage, and have 50% chance to become poisoned. Does not affect the caster or undead, ghosts/spirits, or demons. Poison deals 1D4+1 U damage per turn for the spell's duration
spell.name: Black Wrath

spell.description: All beings within range loose 2 actions per turn, suffer Mute effect, are blinded permanently if they fail a WIL check, and suffer listed damage. Only affects undead, ghosts/spirits, demons, etc. Valid targets with less than 100 maximum HP within range of the spell are instantly vaporized.
spell.name: Cleansing Wave

spell.description: Allows caster to communicate mentally (similar to Telepathy) with ghosts, spirits, etc.
spell.name: Communicate with Spirits

spell.description: All beings within range loose 2 actions for each of the next 5 turns, suffer damage, become poisoned (2D10 U per turn), and have 75% chance to become paralyzed for the duration of the spell. Does not affect the caster, spirits, undead or demons.
spell.name: Dark Apocalypse

spell.description: All beings within range loose 1 action next turn and suffer damage. Does not affect the caster.
spell.name: Dark Curse

spell.description: All beings within range loose 1 action for each of the next 3 turns, suffer listed damage, become poisoned (2D6 U per turn), and have 25% chance to become paralyzed for the duration of the spell. Does not affect the caster, demons, undead, ghosts, or spirits.
spell.name: Demon Song

spell.description: Caster forms a glowing ball of pure magical-spritual energy at his fingertips. The ball then detonates outwards in a powerful blast. The spell deals full damage to spirits and undead. It deals half damage, as C, to all other targets within range.
spell.name: Energy Blast

spell.description: All beings within range loose 1 action for each of the next 4 turns, suffer damage, become poisoned (1D8+1 U per turn), and have 50% chance to become paralyzed for the duration of the spell. Does not affect the caster, demons, undead, ghosts, or spirits.
spell.name: Evil Essence

spell.description: A sphere of light 500 feet in radius emanates from the caster. All beings within range loose 2 actions per turn, if they fail a WIL check they are muted and blinded permanently, and suffer listed damage. Each subsequent turn of the spell's duration inflicts additional damage equal to half the previous turn. Only affects undead, ghosts/spirits, demons, etc. Valid targets with less than 100 maximum HP within range of the spell are instantly vaporized.
spell.name: Great Gospel

spell.description: A soft rain falls from the sky, healing everything that it touches 1 HP a turn.
spell.name: Healing Rain

spell.description: Enchants a single weapon (archaic weapon, a single bullet, etc.). Enchanted weapon is now considered magical and can damage supernatural creatures, spirits, etc, as normal. Weapon also has [+3] damage. Enchantment lasts for 1 strike only, after which the weapon reverts to normal.
spell.name: Holy Sigil

spell.description: Allows caster to determine the vital statistics of a spirit or demon (HP, most of it's skills, attributes, etc.)
spell.name: Light Scrying

spell.description: Caster enchants a small object (less than 1 cubic foot). Any spirit, demon, or undead touching the object will suffer 1D10 x 20 damage. Once the damage is dealt, spell expires. Merely by getting NEAR the ward the target suffers 1D10 x 2 damage per turn. (this does not make spell expire)
spell.name: Major Ward

spell.description: Caster enchants a small object (less than 1 cubic foot). Any spirit or demon touching the object will suffer 1D10 x 5 damage. Once the damage is dealt, spell expires.
spell.name: Minor Ward

spell.description: All beings within range loose 1 action per turn, have 70% to suffer Mute effect, are blinded for 1D4+1 turns, and suffer listed damage. Only affects undead, ghosts/spirits, demons, etc.
spell.name: Pulse of Life

spell.description: Caster radiates an intense aura from his body that measures 10 feet in radius. Spirits and Demons must make a WIL check at -10 in order to enter the aura, and thereafter every turn to remain there. Undead that enter the aura will suffer 1D4 damage per turn. The spell lasts 10 minuites, but the caster may extend it at a cost of 1 MP per min
spell.name: Sanctuary

spell.description: All beings within range loose 1 action per turn, have 50% to suffer Mute effect, and suffer listed damage. Only affects undead, ghosts/spirits, and demons, etc.
spell.name: Seal Evil

spell.description: A spell you cast that is not an auto hit, is now an auto hit. Cast at the same time as you are casting the spell in question.
spell.name: Seeking

spell.description: Caster creates a small, glowing blue orb which then travels to target location within caster's sight range. Upon arrival, it detonates, scattering magical spikes in all directions. After traveling 10 feet, the spikes disappear. Will damage non-corpreal targets. Deals half damage vs. normal targets
spell.name: Spirit Bomb

spell.description: Unleashes a deadly rain of magical spikes upon one 5x5 foot area. Treat as piercing damage. Will affect ghosts, spirits, etc. Deals half damage vs. normal targets
spell.name: Spirit Nail

spell.description: Forces any one target ghost or spirit to break apart into a hazy fog. Target requires 1D6 minutes to re-assemble. Non-corporeal ghosts can attempt to re-assemble themselves in 1 turn with a WIL check at -5.
spell.name: Spirit Scatter

spell.description: Moaning sprits swirl out from the caster within a 100 foot radius. The spirits seek out living targets the caster wishes, and attempt to steal a small part of their soul. Anyone that has a spirit hit them takes 1D10-1 U damage. Any targets within the range have a 50% chance per turn to be struck by a spirit.
spell.name: Storm of Spirits

spell.description: Can be used to heal or damage a target. Effect is somewhat random: target looses 3D6 HP and gains 3D6 HP. For each X, caster can add [+1] to either of the die rolls that he chooses. Luck points cannot be added to this spell to increase damage. The target can spend 1 luck point to nullify the spell. No effect on non-living targets (such as mecha or robots)
spell.name: Touch of Fate

spell.description: Allows caster to determine exactly what a particular target is. Spell will reveal if the target is human, alien, beast, demon, spirit, illusion, machine, etc. It the target is alive the spell will reveal the basic emotional state of the target as well.
spell.name: True Sense

spell.description: All beings within range loose 1 action per turn, suffer Mute effect, are blinded for 1D4+1 turns, and suffer damage. Only affects undead, ghosts/spirits, demons, etc. Valid targets with less than 60 maximum HP within range of the spell are instantly vaporized.
spell.name: White Beacon

spell.description: Deals 1D10 U
spell.name: White Beam

spell.description:
A powerful enchantment causes all atoms within one target to cease all movement for a fraction of a second.
X is the size of the target.
Cold-resistance of any sort (including magical protection) has no effect versus this spell
spell.name: Absolute Zero

spell.description: Freezes the ground (or floor) in a given area no larger than 200 square feet. Anything in the area becomes stuck to the ground, as icy stalagmites form on the ground and spear upwards into the target area. This can only be used on a given area once until the first casting expires.
spell.name: Biting Frost

spell.description:
Allows the target to breathe water as if it were normal air. This works with both fresh and salt water.
Note that if the character is inhaling dirty water then the character may be affected by any poisions the water may contain.
This spell makes it very easy to swim long distances or to deep depths becasue the character does not have to return to the surface to breathe. However, it does not convey extraordinary swimming ability.
spell.name: Breathe Water

spell.description:
Caster can create pure water from his fingertip. 1 liter is created per 1 MP spent beyond the basic casting cost. The water flows out from the finger in a steady stream similar to a faucet.
The water created by this spell is normal water in all regards and it remains behind permanently.
spell.name: Create Water

spell.description:
Converts the water in one target into its gaseous components, which results in an explosion.
X is the size of the target. This spell is only effective against targets that contain water (such as most living creatures). It has no effect on sprits, robots, and so on.
spell.name: Dissociate

spell.description: Attacks one target with a fierce assault of rain, sleet, and hail. Can only cause superficial damage. Double armor against this spell.
spell.name: Driving Rain

spell.description: Caster can drain away the water from a non-living object and transfer it into his body (as if drinking) Can drain about one pint of water at a time. This allows the character to drink dirty or posioned water without suffering any ill effects.
spell.name: Dry Touch

spell.description: By touching something, the caster can infuse it with a deep cold. This can cause damage in living targets.
spell.name: Freezing Touch

spell.description: Freezing cold winds attack the target
spell.name: Freezing Wind

spell.description: Attacks one target with a fast moving, ice spear. Once impaled in the target, it explodes dealing further damage.
spell.name: Frozen Spear

spell.description: Freezing cold winds and pellets of hail strike the target.
spell.name: Hailstorm

spell.description: Caster forms a huge ball of water above his head. Portions of the water can be shot off into powerful weapons thereafter. It takes 2 actions to create the ball. Up to 2 shots can be fired per action thereafter. The ball holds X shots. The ball can be detonated to deal normal damage times the number of shots left in the ball in a 10' radius.
spell.name: Hydroblast

spell.description: Blasts a snake-like column of pressurized water from the caster's hands, which the caster can control like a weapon. Caster uses magical control to strike with the wave as he sees fit. Can also be used to parry. Can end spell at will
spell.name: Hydrospear

spell.description: Caster throws a small knifelike icicle up to 100' away
spell.name: Ice Dart

spell.description: Generates a circular wall, ten feet in radius, three feet thick, thirty feet high, with 400 hit points, of ice surrounding the caster.
spell.name: Ice Fortress

spell.description: Creates a large wall of ice, three feet thick, 50 feet x 25 feet in size, with 1000 hit points, oriented as the caster wishes (one edge must be on attached to a structural object).
spell.name: Ice Wall

spell.description: Target is encased in large block of magical ice for the duration of the spell. If the spell is forced to expire by the caster, then it does not shatter. For each turn the target is trapped within the Ice Prison, they take 1D6-1 D damage due to the extreme cold. At the end of the duration the block shatters, causing the listed damage. While within the block of ice, the target is immune to physical attacks. The block of ice has 200 hit points, and if destroyed before the duration of the spell or the target breaks out (requires a STR check at -15 and can be attempted once per turn), then it does not deal the shatter damage.
spell.name: lcy prison

spell.description: Covers the caster and his clothes, etc, with a coating of water approximatley 1 inch thick. The water will appear to be stuck to the caster and will maintain its thickness and shape as he moves around. The water provides armor of 10/15/20 while the spell is in effect. Fire magic or attacks with fire effect will damage the coating. If 50 HP are dealt by fire damage the spell ends. The spell does not protect vs. U.
spell.name: Liquid Cloak

spell.description: Generates a circular wall, ten feet in radius, three feet thick, thirty feet high, and 350 hit points, of fast-moving water surrounding the caster. Other attributes of the wall are similar to water wall, but if a person attempts to enter the wall, they take 2D6 C damage from the pummeling waters.
spell.name: Maelstrom Wall

spell.description:
A cloud of mist and fog blasts outward from the caster, completley obscuring the caster's square and partially obscuring the surrounding 8 squares.
The obscuration of the central square offers dense cover between it and any outside squares. (-12 to strike in or out)
The partially obscured outer squares provide half cover (-8 to strike in or out)
The obscuring mist affects normal vision as well as thermal vision. The obscured area remains in place for the duration of the spell (it does not follow the caster)
spell.name: Mist Veil

spell.description: Caster transforms himself into a cloud of fog-like mist. Caster may move the mist around at will, and can travel anywhere that air can normally travel. While in this form caster can see, but cannot hear. Caster cannot suffer physical damage, hold objects, speak, cast magic, etc. in this form.
spell.name: Mistform

spell.description: Caster throws a small puff of extremely cold air at the target.
spell.name: Puff of Cold

spell.description:
Caster becomes immune to all forms of poisons, including biological, natural, chemical and neurological types, for the duration of the spell.
This instantly nullifies all poisons in the caster's body, and renders the caster immune to outside posions as well.
spell.name: Resist Poison

spell.description: Coats a surface up to 10 square feet with a slick, hard, coating of ice. This can only be used on relatively flat, un-moving, surfaces (walls, floors, the ground, etc.) and CANNOT be used on living tissue. Cannot directly cause damage.
spell.name: Sheet of ice

spell.description: Thermal drain causes the target's fluids to freeze solid
spell.name: Thermal Drain

spell.description: Generates a loud thunderclap-like noise.
spell.name: Thunderclap

spell.description: Caster throws a cone of vapor, mist, and water droplets from his outstretched arms. This spell duplicates the effects of Focused Gust (Air magic) except that the force direction is always away from the caster. As well, anything in the target area becomes soaking wet. The water created by the spell remains permanently.
spell.name: Vapor Cone

spell.description: Target gains the ability to walk on water as if it were a normal surface. Target can also walk on wet, oily, slimy, or icy, surfaces without danger of slipping, etc.
spell.name: Walk on Water

spell.description: Shoots a fine stream of pressurized water from the caster's finger. It is excellent for cutting objects.
spell.name: Water Laser

spell.description: Creates a large wall of water, roughly 3 x 50 x 25 feet, with 250 hit points, oriented as the caster wishes. Wall is immune to physical damage. It can only be damaged by electricity, magical fire, or pure magical damage. Something can walk through the wall by making a STR check at -3*size and spending three actions.
spell.name: Water Wall

spell.description: Summons a fierce shower of frozen, razor-like raindrops. Can deal damage X times, divided how caster chooses, among any number of targets. The same target can be chosen multiple times. Only one target is damaged per turn, so each additional target (X), the duration of Wicked Rain is extended.
spell.name: Wicked Rain

spell.description: The caster can send out a small wisp of biting cold to strike a target no more than 100' away. Can be cast no more than half the caster's level of Magical Control in a turn.
spell.name: Wisp of Frost

skill.description:
[LaTeX]
The skill of attacking with and parrying (if applicable) with the given (archaic) weapon type. Archaic weapons include both Melee and Ranged. The damage and type of the weapon is listed in the Equipment section. Note that \emph{Archaic Weapons} actually encompasses many different skills.
\begin{description} \item[Class] skills are for individual \emph{classes} of archaic weapon, such as \emph{Axe} or \emph{Polearm}. These must be bought individual and are Rank 1 skills. \item[Super Class] skills are for groups of \emph{classes}. These groups are:
\textscbf{Stick} Long Swords, Short Swords, Knives, Blunt
\textscbf{Axes} Axes, Blunt
\textscbf{Flexible} Chained, Monofilament, Ships
\textscbf{Great} Staves, Polearms
\textscbf{Missile} Ranged, Thrown
\emph{SuperClasses} are Rank 2 and not Rank 1. A \emph{SuperClass} may \emph{never} be Specialized. \item[Exotic] Certain weapons are Exotic (most of these are in the Exotic category, but some are within other categories). All Exotic weapons \emph{require} that you purchase an individual skill for them. For example, the Zaghnal is Exotic, in order to use the Zaghnal, a character must purchase the specific skill \emph{Zaghnal}. Exotic skills may be specialized. \end{description}
\parindent=5pt \everypar{\hangindent=20pt \hangafter=1} In addition, any non-Exotic and non-Chained weapon can be used as a blunt weapon. It deals damage as a low-quality club of the same mass. Blunt weapons may be manufactured \emph{ad hoc} from items laying around, i.e. rolling-pins, chair-legs, lead-pipe. As we know this will come up, a limb that includes the \emph{joint} and significant portions of both the upper and lower section, is considered chained and thus \emph{may not} be used.
skill.name: Archaic Weapons

skill.description:
[LaTeX]
Knock over an opponent (like a trip) by running through or at them. You must move at least 10 feet immediately prior to this action. Roll a \textscbf{Str} check against the opponent, where they get a [-LVL] (raw!) to their roll. A \emph{Barrel Charge} deals 1D6 C damage.
skill.name: Barrel Charge

skill.description:
[LaTeX]
Grappling is an attack that seeks to grab and restrain the target rather than dealing immediate damage. It may also be used as a set-up for aother martial arts techniques that require the target to be grappled first.
The target may defend against the grappler in one of four different ways.
\VBoxColumnPicture{Images/MartialArts/Bubishi.png}
\begin{enumerate} \item If the target is not grappled, then he may \emph{Dodge} \item If the target is not grappled and has a melee weapon, then he may defend by parrying \item If the target is grappled, or not suitably armed but also has the \emph{Grapple} skill, then he may engage in a contest-of-skills with the grappler (wrestling) \item Otherwise the target may attempt a \textscbf{Str} check with a \textsl{raw} minus equal to the Grappler's LVL in \emph{Grapple} \end{enumerate}
\parindent=5pt \everypar{\hangindent=20pt \hangafter=1} Grapples are ineffective against amorphous or incorporeal creatures unless otherwise noted. Once in a grapple the grappled opponent may attempt to break free on any of his actions. A grappled target is at -2*LVL to defend against the grappler (\textscbf{Str}-checking, or Grapple-contest).
\parindent=5pt \everypar{\hangindent=20pt \hangafter=1} If a target is \emph{Grapple}d they can \emph{Grapple} the attacker without any minuses. If the target succeeds then both are considered \emph{Grappled}. This is called \emph{Wrestling}.
skill.name: Grapple

skill.description:
[LaTeX]
The skill of attacking with various modern weapons. Choose the weapon type when purchasing this skill. There are no \emph{SuperClass} equivalents (as in \emph{Archaic Weapons}). However, for all firearms of roughly the same period it is assumed that anyone can at least fire them (given that they can figure out how to load, chamber, turn off the safety, etc.) The important ability this skill confers is to be able to operate and shoot accurately and swiftly in a high-stress environment.
skill.name: Modern Weapons

skill.description:
[LaTeX]
You deliver a P, C, or S blow using your fist or foot (\textsl{Punch} and \textsl{Kick}, respectively). The damage for a for a kick is $X$D6 and for a punch is $X$D4, where $X$ is the Rank of the skill. A martial srtist may increase the Rank of this skill even after he has bought it.
\quotexample[Rei hits harder]{Rei has decided that he wants to hit harder with his punches and kicks. He currently has Rank 2, Level 4, \emph{Punch/Kick}. He decides to increase the Rank of his \emph{Punch/Kick} to 3. The cost of a Rank 2, Level 4 skill is 20; the cost of a Rank 3, Level 4 skill is 30, so he owes $30-20=10$ character points.}
The Maximum Strength Bonus (MSB) of \emph{Punch/Kick} is ``unlimited,'' and the Minimum Strength Requirement (MSR) is 8. Characters with less than an 8 \textscbf{STR} can still purchase \emph{Punch/Kick} but have a negative to the raw damage they deal.
A kick is always considered the most off-hand weapon; that is, if you only kick you are at a -3 to strike. If you punch and kick, the punch is at -3, and kick at -6. If you do two punches and a kick, then the punches are -3 and -6, and the kick is -9 to strike. This can be mitigated by ambidexterity.
skill.name: Punch/Kick

skill.description:
[LaTeX]
A throw is an attack that is performed against a grappled target. It causes damage and also knocks the target down, forcing the target to spend actions to get back up again.
The target takes 1d6 C damage per LVL. Once the throw is performed, the \emph{Grapple} is automatically released. The target is thrown in any direction of the martial artist five feet for each LVL in \emph{Throw}. The martial artist may choose to throw the target straight down at his feet instead. Throw may not be blocked, parried, or dodged. However, the target may attempt to reduce damage by supernatural means, such as blink, or by a successful \emph{Acrobatics} check with a minus equal to the damage dealt.
skill.name: Throw
Ambidexterity

skill.description:
[LaTeX]
You have experience fighting when your vision is compromised or obscured due to injury, darkness, smoke, or other impediments to your vision. Each level in Blind Fighting reduces the negative to fighting blind by 2; it may not be used to add a positive bonus. Blind Fighting is only effective for ranges less than 5*LVL feet. Blind Fighting does not mitigate strike penalties for cover.
skill.name: Blind Fighting

skill.description: You are experienced at fighting while carrying large amounts of weight or encumbering loads, especially armor. This skill adds 3*LVL to the Encumbrance sub-attribute.
skill.name: Burden

skill.description:
[LaTeX]
You may cast spells in combat. Without this skill, if you are struck or must defend, you automatically fail to cast any spell and you lose the Mana Points. With this skill, if you \emph{fail} your defensive roll, then the spell fails, but the Mana Points are not lost. You only ever need one level in \emph{Combat Casting}.
All spells you cast now count as \textsc{Special} skills for the purpose of modification, etc. with Martial Arts. For the purposes of \emph{Jitsu}, \emph{Waza}, etc., alls spells are considered to be a \textsc{Special} skill whose name is \emph{Spell}.
\quotexample[Ulek's Fire-Bomb]{Ulek finds himself having to blast the crap out of opponents---standing right next to him. He gets a level in \emph{Jitsu} and picks \emph{Spell} (\emph{Combat Casting}). He then gets a \emph{Waza} combining \emph{Fireball} and \emph{Minor Teleport}. Now, when an opponent get's too close, he can fire-off his \emph{Fireball}-\emph{Minor Teleport} (given that he has enough actions).}
As in Ulek's case, note that the effect of the spells are delayed until the last spell comes into effect. If order is important, this is determined by the Mage; the effects can ``cross-cut.''
skill.name: Combat Casting
Combat Etiquette

skill.description:
[LaTeX]
Understanding of combat terrain, troop movement, weather and combat condition impact on the terrain. Adds 3 to your Leadership rolls per level.
Upon entering combat a character may spend actions to become \textsl{familiar} with the local terrain. \textsl{Familiarity} means that the character takes no minuses from slick, unlevel or otherwise difficult-to-traverse terrain, given that he has an appropriate skill knowledge (like \emph{acrobatics} or \emph{climb}). This skill is rolled with a minus equal to the ``difficulty'' of the terrain and a bonus of LVL*Actions-spent-studying.
If the character is familiar with the local terrain then if he has to dodge by ``throwing himself to the ground'' he gets an additional die. The character is also acutely aware in changes in the environment and gets a bonus to his Perception equal to 2*LVL in \emph{Combat Terrain}.
skill.name: Combat Terrain

skill.description:
[LaTeX]
Knowledge and practical experience with combat. The primary bonus is that for each LVL in combat training gain one move-equivalent action. The characteris also familiar with appropriate strategies of order-of-battle and platoon, developing enfilading fire, retreat, modes of advance, etc.
If multiple characters have \emph{Combat Training}, then simple (standard) combat maneuvers can be carried out without verbal (only visual) communication, given that they have trained together for at least one week prior. With simple verbal commands or hand-signals, highly-developed or coordinated maneuvers can be carried out (the requirement of previous group practice still holds). Characters may also attack and defend ``as a unit,'' thus if two characters have \emph{Combat Training} and are immediately adjacent to each other (typically 5 feet), then when initiative is rolled, they can choose to take either of the rolled initiatives.
\quotexample[Myk and Travis: the \textit{machine}]{Myk and Travis have trained together as years: Myk uses sword-and-shield, and Travis with the polearm. They both have three levels in \emph{Combat Training}. Travis has three levels in \emph{Readiness}. At the beginning of combat they both roll initiative, Myk rolls (and gets) a 12, Travis rolls an 11, with his \emph{Readiness} he has $11+6=17$. Both Myk and Travis choose to go on the iniative of 17.}
skill.name: Combat Training

skill.description:
[LaTeX]
You are particular quick on your feet in combat. Add LVL to your Movement.
skill.name: Fast Move

skill.description:
[LaTeX]
You are especially skilled at handling very large weapons. You are assumed to have 1 STR per LVL for the purposes of weapon use only; but only for weapon-use. This effects your Minimum Strength Requirement and your Raw Damage bonus.
skill.name: Great Weapon
Jitsu
Kata

skill.description:
[LaTeX]
Pick a \textsc{Basic} skill and a \textsc{Modifier}, this then becomes a new Rank 1 \textsc{Special} skill. Note that this a different mechanism than \emph{Jitsu}; for \emph{Jitsu} each level you purchase converts one \textsc{Special} or \textsc{Defensive} skill into a \textsc{Basic} skill, whereas \emph{Kung Fu} generates a new skill that is a combination of the \textsc{Basic} and \textsc{Modifier} skill you chose. Buying more levels in \emph{Kung Fu} is the same as buying levels in both skills (cheaper, but less flexible).
A martial artist may purchase many different combinations of \emph{Kung Fu}, as suits him. If the martial artist choose a \textsc{Basic} skill that has variable Rank, then the total cost of \emph{Kung Fu} is just the variable cost of the of the \textsc{Basic} skill. You \textit{\textbf{may not}} use a variable cost \textsc{Special} skill in \emph{Kung Fu}.
skill.name: Kung Fu

skill.description: The ability to draw a weapon as fast as possible; a successful quickdraw roll means that the weapon is drawn using 0 actions. Failure means that the next action is used (even if that is the first action of the next turn). The more complicated the attempt the more successes are needed, thus quickdrawing a pistol from a holster at the waist is one success, a hidden knife in a leg holster might require three, etc.
skill.name: Quick Draw

skill.description: On a successful roll, reholster a weapon in zero time, failure means the character uses an action, if there are no actions left for the character this turn, it uses the first action of her next turn.
skill.name: Quick Holster

skill.description: The ability to reload a gun, bow, or crossbow as quickly as possible. On a successful skill roll, the character can replace a magazine, use a speed loader in a revolver, draw and nock an arrow, or pump a shotgun without using an action. For bows, this will reduce the recover time by 1 action per level automatically. Failure implies that the normal time was required (and must be spent) even if this is an action next round.
skill.name: Quick Load

skill.description: Add 2*LVL to all quick- skills and 2*LVL to your initiative.
skill.name: Readiness

skill.description: You are able to resist fatigue and pain and can keep active when others would fall. You gain +2 per level to your WIL rolls to resist falling unconscious or to regain consciousness from stunning attacks, knock-out attacks, painful blows, torture, falling below 1 Hit Point, and similar circumstances.
skill.name: Resist Wounds

skill.description: Spend an action in communication with the opponent; that opponent must make a WIL save with a negative equal to your LVL in taunt, or must target you instead.
skill.name: Taunt

skill.description: The martial artist is unusually sturdy and well built; his training and combat experience has hardened the skin and bones. Each level of Toughness provides a 1 bonus to P--S--C (as natural armor).
skill.implementation: Piercing += Level; Crushing += Level; Slashing += Level;
skill.name: Toughness
Waza

skill.description: Recovery time is reduced by LVL.
skill.name: Weapon Burden

skill.description:
[LaTeX]
This skills requires \emph{Dodge}.
You expect that an attack is incoming and prepare yourself beforehand. When the attack comes, you automatically dodge the attack.
This skill has the same restrictions as \emph{Dodge}. You must spend one action during your turn to do nothing but prepare to perform \emph{Anticipated Dodge}. At this time you must declare a specific opponent. You must be able to see this opponent. If the declared opponent attacks you before your next turn then you may automatically dodge the attack with no skill roll needed. You may dodge up to LVL attacks in this manner, however they must all be from the same designated opponent.
skill.name: Anticipated Dodge

skill.description: You may parry missile and thrown weapons with your weapon; use your weapon skill to determine if you parry.
skill.name: Arrow Smasher

skill.description: You are skilled at protecting your comerades in a fight. To use Defend Other you must declare during your turn which of your comerades you are defending. You must be within 10 feet of your comerade and you must meet the conditions stipulated in Dodge as well (though these stipulations do not apply to your comerade). Your comerade must be willing or unconcious for you to defend them. You may choose to defend for that character up to LVL times before your next action. When you do this you are making the defensive roll for the other character. The character being defended may also attempt a defensive maneuver of their own, both of you are still protected by any supernatural effects that may be active and whatever armor you both are wearing. You must choose an interferential defensive maneuver that you know, such as parry, block, preemptive strike, etc. If you use Defend other, then roll the defensive maneuver of your choice. If you succeed then continue as if you were attacked rather than the defender. If you fail on your defensive maneuver roll, then the original target is struck by the attack and you loose your next action.
skill.name: Defend Other
